Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About Acast

Since 2014, Acast has been building the world‚Äôs most valuable podcast marketplace, creating the technology that connects podcast creators, advertisers, and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 140,000 podcasts, 3,300 advertisers, and one billion quarterly listens. Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen‚Äîacross any podcast app or listening platform.

About The Role

We are looking for a Software Engineer for the Acast Intelligence team. The ideal candidate would be able to build things like a modern recommendation engine, truly understanding it instead of just piecing it together, probably thanks to a solid background in statistics or related fields. We‚Äôre after someone who can cut through the hype, focus on real value that LLMs and related tech can bring, and always keep their eyes on the prize: driving growth for our company and our marketplace‚Äôs users.

Team‚Äôs scope

The team is focused on recommendation systems and intelligent automation. Our product vision is a set of connected systems that turn deep and broad data into decisions and reduce friction, helping one person achieve as much as five would. We build to enable podcast creators to grow their audience, advertisers to be matched to creators, and internal teams to focus on what matters most instead of getting bogged down in chasing data.

This work has a company-wide impact.

Team composition and tools

The team is small but made up of seasoned engineers. We deploy on AWS, and most of our company‚Äôs code is in TypeScript, including the infrastructure, but some of this particular team‚Äôs code is in Python for the reasons you‚Äôd expect. We collaborate on our projects and keep the work process light. Our PM knows the space in and out. We‚Äôve shipped the first version of a recommendation engine, and there‚Äôs plenty more in the pipeline. There aren‚Äôt many established best practices or ready answers in this field, so the work is a lot about experimentation and learning.

Experience we‚Äôre looking for


Background and interest in some of the following: statistics, machine learning, LLMs, recommendation systems, RAG systems (experience with their evaluation is a plus)
Proficiency in Python, familiarity with TypeScript (or the other way around)
Familiarity with vector databases
A habit of staying up to date in a seriously evolving field
Experience with or interest in learning AWS
Experience building software that‚Äôs actually delightful for the users
A pragmatic mindset for making sensible trade-offs
Interest in podcasts is really optional, but if you have it, this job will be so much more fun


Logistics

We are remote-first but prefer to have teams in similar timezones; for this team, this means an overlap of at least 4 hours with CET (UTC+1).

Culture

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.

Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We‚Äôre global and have remote teams, so it‚Äôs even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.

We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.

We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a driven and skilled Data Scientist to design, deploy, and optimize ML models that drive automation and impact key areas like credit risk and fraud detection. Join us to shape the future of ML at Froda!

About Froda

Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission ‚Äì to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy and affordable for business owners to invest in their ideas. Our objective approach champions diversity, ensures fair terms, and ultimately enables more small businesses to make a positive impact on society.

Join our team and contribute to giving small businesses the opportunity to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.

Your Impact

Design, build, and deploy machine learning models to drive automation and efficiency across areas like credit risk, fraud detection, AML, customer service, and business analytics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable, robust solutions that support Froda‚Äôs strategic goals of scalability, standardization, and reliability.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with product, engineering, and analytics teams to deliver scalable and impactful AI and ML solutions.
Design, build, and deploy ML models and pipelines for critical business areas.
Implement and optimize ML-Ops workflows (data processing, model training, deployment, and monitoring).


What You'll Bring


Experience of working as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer in tech, fintech, or a similar product-driven company.
Hands-on experience with production ML pipelines, ML-Ops frameworks, and cloud platforms (e.g., KubeFlow, Azure).
Proven skills in Python, SQL, and ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT APIs, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG).
Knowledge of credit risk, fraud detection, or AML is a clear plus.


Who You Are


Results-driven problem solver with a passion for impact through data and AI and that thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Collaborative team player, contributing to innovation and knowledge-sharing in the team and across the business.
Strong communicator, able to break down complex ideas into clear insights.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

Working at Froda means working at a company that combines the best of both worlds ‚Äì fun and fast-paced culture, yet stable and structured. We are 90+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, while having fun together. You will have the ability to impact your own work and that the only thing standing between you and your goals is going to be your own ambitions.

Furthermore, you‚Äôll get:


Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
Competitive compensation package
Insurance and pension plan


Be part of a growing team where your work directly impacts the company‚Äôs success. Join us in driving meaningful change through AI and machine learning.

Please note that due to summer vacations, our response time may be delayed.

Title: Data Scientist PredAI
Description:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for multiple data scientists or machine learning engineers focusing on generative AI for text, and Large Language Models.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

What you‚Äôll be doing:


Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications
Keep up to date with the latest AI developments to shape our Gen AI best practices and tooling
Document models and processes to ensure compliance and meet our compliance and risk management standards


The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki.

Who You Are

This is the right role if you have a passion to solve challenging problems - with the help of data, software and AI. As a person, you look past the noise, to do what is right. You prefer action to talking, but when you talk, people want to listen.

Your experience and background:


MSc or PhD in a field related to predictive or statistical modelling.
At least 2 years‚Äô experience developing machine learning solutions in python, with a focus on model validation and explainability in a production grade system.
Exposure to multiple predictive AI projects, either through work or Kaggle or similar.
A knack for tackling complex problems and creating simple solutions.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas and technology across domains.


It would be ideal if you also:


Experience from working on AWS
Experience developing production grade code


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it‚Äôs to take their career to the next level. For others, it‚Äôs to break new ground within their area of expertise ‚Äì in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model ‚Äì we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/08/2025. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Peter N√∂dtveidt (bjorn.hertzberg@nordea.com)

The recruitment process consists of the following steps:


Preliminary CV selection
Phone conversation with the recruiter
Online interview with the hiring leader
Background check


We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do ‚Äì when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers‚Äô needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

For candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansf√∂rbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

For candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì with GenAI & Front-End Development Skills
Description:
Jobbsammanfattning

Kiwa is one of the global leaders in Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC), helping industries, governments, and institutions build trust and ensure quality. As part of our digital transformation, we‚Äôre scaling AI-driven services and product capabilities. We are now hiring a Machine Learning Engineer who combines strong machine learning foundation with Generative AI (GenAI) experience and front-end development skills to build user-centric, intelligent applications.

Om rollen

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in designing, building, and deploying scalable machine learning systems and GenAI-powered tools that enhance our services‚Äîspanning audit automation, inspection optimization, report generation, and operational intelligence. You‚Äôll also collaborate with software developers to integrate ML outputs into clean, interactive web interfaces for business users.

Your Key Responsibilities


Develop, deploy, and maintain ML/AI models, with a focus on NLP, GenAI, and applied deep learning use cases.
Build proof-of-concept and production-grade GenAI applications (e.g., LLM-driven audit report summarizers, inspection support chatbots).
Collaborate with data scientists to operationalize models using modern MLOps practices.
Design and implement intuitive front-end interfaces for internal tools or customer-facing AI features using modern web frameworks.
Work across the stack (front-end to ML APIs) to ensure seamless integration between user interfaces and model backends.
Optimize performance and scalability of both models and UI components.
Ensure compliance with AI ethics, model governance, and data security standards.
Work cross-functionally with product managers, domain experts, and IT teams.


Your location will be Solna, but you will be working globally.

Har du vad som kr√§vs?


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
3+ years of experience in machine learning engineering or applied AI roles.
Proficiency in Python and key ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, LangChain).
Experience with building and fine-tuning LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Mistral, LLaMA) and implementing prompt engineering techniques.
Solid understanding of REST APIs, containerization (Docker), and CI/CD pipelines for ML.
Experience in front-end development using modern frameworks (e.g., React, Vue, Angular).
Knowledge of JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML/CSS, and UI/UX principles.
Experience deploying ML apps on cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP), specifically Microsoft Azure.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with MLOps platforms (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, SageMaker).
Familiarity with vector databases, RAG architecture, and knowledge retrieval systems.
Prior experience building internal tools for enterprise environments (especially in B2B or industrial domains).
Understanding of accessibility, responsive design, and user-centric UI principles.


Vad kan du f√∂rv√§nta dig av oss i geng√§ld?

Kiwa is one of the most successful companies in inspection, testing, certification, and technical consulting, thanks to our employees who, through their dedication and expertise, contribute to safety and sustainability for our customers and society as a whole. That‚Äôs why Kiwa invests heavily in its employees and their development. Through your daily work, exciting projects, and training opportunities, you and your skills will continuously grow as part of Kiwa! At Kiwa, teamwork comes before individual interests, and together we create a positive work environment where everyone is part of a greater community‚Äîthe Kiwa community!


Secure and stable employment - Kiwa has collective agreements
Generous wellness allowance
Compensation for medical care, vaccinations, and the opportunity for a thorough health analysis
A time bank so you can take time off when it suits you‚Äînot just on public holidays
The chance to join Kiwa‚Äôs ski trip with around 100 fantastic colleagues


How To Apply

Apply via our website and register your CV.

Selection and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.

For questions regarding the position, please contact Unit Manager Fatah Mohammad at +46104793018 or email the recruiter Sofia Kjellstr√∂m at sofia.kjellstrom@kiwa.com.

For this recruitment, we have carefully considered our advertising channels and therefore kindly ask not to be contacted by recruitment or advertising agencies.

Om Kiwa/About Kiwa

We ARE Kiwa - Are you?

At Kiwa, our core values‚ÄîAmbitious, Reliable, and Engaged (ARE)‚Äîare the foundation of everything we do.

Do you identify with these values? Do you strive to build trust and credibility with customers and colleagues? Is the safety of individuals and society important to you?

Kiwa is currently one of the most successful companies in inspection, testing, certification, and technical consulting. We are a global player with strong local presence. We maintain strong customer relationships and high service standards, with a focus on safety, technology, and sustainability. We offer a wide range of services in process safety, property and lift safety, agriculture, as well as the food and construction industries. As a group, we operate in over 40 countries and have around 12,000 employees worldwide. In Sweden, we have about twenty offices from Kiruna to Malm√∂, where a total of 900 employees work together for a safer society.

Additional Information

Kiwa aims to maintain a drug-free workplace. Therefore, random alcohol and drug testing is conducted throughout the year.

Background checks may be carried out during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Scientist - Game Marketing
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Embark Studios you will leverage data to drive insights and optimizations for our marketing campaigns, collaborating with marketing and agency teams to ensure we connect effectively with our audience. This role requires hands-on experience with digital advertising platforms and a strong technical background in SQL or Python for advanced data analysis.

As our portfolio of games expands, we‚Äôre seeking a data-savvy Data Scientist with an enthusiasm for gaming to help us maximize the performance of our digital marketing efforts across platforms. We are driven by data and a passion for games, constantly exploring ways to optimize our reach and engagement.

Example Of Responsibilities


Analyze campaign data from platforms such as Google Ads, Meta Ads, and TikTok Ads to assess performance, extract insights, and inform decision-making.
Create custom dashboards and reports to track KPIs, using insights to drive strategy adjustments and optimize performance.
Leverage A/B testing and other testing methodologies to enhance campaign performance and refine targeting strategies.
Work closely with in-house marketing team and external agencies to strategize, execute, and enhance campaigns that increase brand reach and player engagement.



We would love if you have


Experience in digital marketing analysis, with hands-on work in Google Ads, Meta Ads, or TikTok Ads.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data analysis.
Experience working with agencies or third-party partners to drive marketing results.
Strong analytical mindset with excellent attention to detail.
Solid understanding of digital marketing metrics, such as CTR, CPC, CPA, and ROAS.
Familiarity with visualization tools (such as Looker, or Google Data Studio).
Effective communicator, capable of translating data insights into clear, actionable strategies.
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you (in English)!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Rillion, we're looking for a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer to join our AI product team. You'll help us improve and expand the machine learning components that power our Accounts Payable (AP) automation. From idea to deployment, you'll work closely with others across the company to bring smart, ML-driven features into our product. If you enjoy solving real problems with data and want to be part of a collaborative, fast-moving team, we‚Äôd love to have you on board!




Responsibilities:

You‚Äôll play a key role in building and integrating custom Machine Learning functionalities into our SaaS products, with a focus on developing our ML platform and creating data-driven solutions tailored to our needs:

Develop and scale our machine learning platform using Databricks.
Design and implement custom ML models tailored to real-world AP automation challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify user needs and integrate ML solutions seamlessly into our SaaS platform.
Stay informed on the latest ML advancements and contribute to shaping our ML strategy and solution design.




What You'll Bring:

Proven experience delivering ML solutions in SaaS or digital product environments.
Solid experience with ML / Data frameworks such as PyTorch, PySpark or similar.
Hands-on experience in production ML pipelines, including batch and real-time inference.
Experience working with both generic and customer tailored models.
A problem-solving mindset with a collaborative, proactive approach, and a curiosity to explore new solutions while staying up to date.
M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.




Bonus skills:

Experience working with Databricks in a production environment.
Experience with software development and microservices.




What we offer:

Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company.
Join a collaborative and supportive product team that will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to production.
Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path.
Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package.
Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office.
Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views).




The recruitment process:

We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment. If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Victoria Stjernstr√∂m at victoria.stjernstrom@rillion.com




About Rillion:

We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years‚Äô experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.

By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because we‚Äôre AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don‚Äôt.

Together with our owners at Altor, we¬¥re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!

Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Aimognad Sweden

AImognad.se was founded with a clear vision to help Swedish organizations become more AI-mature.

By combining expertise in AI, law, and UX design, we've created a platform that offers tailored solutions for different industries.

We strongly believe that AI technology will shape the future for companies and organizations in Sweden.




Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for an Artificial Intelligence Engineer at aimognad.se. The AI Engineer will be responsible for tasks related to pattern recognition, neural networks, software development, and natural language processing. The role is located in Stockholm with the possibility of some remote work.




Qualifications

Pattern Recognition and Neural Networks expertise
Strong background in Computer Science
Software Development skills
Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or related field
Important! You need to have work permit in Sweden.




Tools / Progamming language:

Based on our interactions with our customers and our internal applications. We hope to find someone with knowledge in the following.

Proficiency in Python with hands-on experience using libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or Hugging Face.
Solid understanding of SQL for data querying and integration in AI workflows.
Familiarity with JavaScript or Node.js, especially for deploying AI models in web-based environments.
Experience with TypeScript is a plus‚Äîparticularly if you‚Äôve collaborated with UX or front-end teams.
Comfortable with Bash/Shell scripting for automation and managing compute environments.
(Optional) Knowledge of R for statistical computing and data analysis.
Experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, or GCP) is beneficial.




Who are you:

You‚Äôre someone who sees AI not just as code, but as a responsibility. You thrive in collaborative environments where ethical decisions matter as much as technical ones. You have a passion for building intelligent systems that solve real-world problems‚Äîand you value transparency, impact, and continuous learning.




Our Values

At AImognad.se, we‚Äôre a purpose-driven team committed to making AI understandable, responsible, and impactful. We value curiosity, integrity, and empathy‚Äîbecause we believe meaningful tech starts with listening deeply to real human needs.




Kindly note: We are currently not accepting inquiries from recruitment agencies. We‚Äôre looking to connect directly with talented individuals who share our passion for responsible AI and meaningful innovation.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.




As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team, you‚Äôll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features like Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
At least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have:

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There‚Äôs something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that‚Äôs why we would love to meet you.

  • Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
  • Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
  • A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team, you‚Äôll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features like Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.


The impact you will create:

  • Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
  • Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
  • Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
  • Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
  • Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
  • Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.


What you bring in:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
  • At least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
  • A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
  • Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
  • Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
  • Customer obsession
  • Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time


It would be great if you also have:

  • Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
  • Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
  • Experience with data from mobile applications
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
  • Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/


Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.


This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.


We only accept applications in English.


What we offer:

  • A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
  • A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
  • Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
  • Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There‚Äôs something for everyone!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that‚Äôs why we would love to meet you.

Title: Staff ML Engineer
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description


Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products with a focus on online prediction.
Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems.
Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-Fdeployment.
Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.





Qualifications



Required:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

Comfortable work with multi-cloud setup and experience with AWS or/and GCP and containerized environment like Kubernetes.

Solid understanding of machine learning lifecycle and fundamentals.

Expertise in Python.

Familiarity with Terraform, GitHub and GitHub Actions.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.



Bonus Qualifications:

Experience with Vertex AI, specifically in online prediction.

Experience with Cloud Run and Workload Identity Federation.

Experience with kubeflow pipelines

Experience with Triton inference server and TensorRT

Understanding of data security and privacy regulations.





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Scientist - Games
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Embark, you will play a crucial role in our team of data professionals, focusing specifically on gaming analytics. You will be instrumental in providing insights and support for our game titles, leveraging data to optimize player experience, and providing actionable insights for the game development team. This position presents an exciting opportunity to merge your love for gaming with your expertise in data analytics.

Example Of Responsibilities


Collaborate and work closely with game designers and business stakeholders
Research and develop metrics and performance indicators
Extract, analyze and communicate insights from gameplay data
Design telemetry logging
Communicate results clearly and concisely to stakeholders from both game and commercial teams



We would love if you have


A creative and curious mind
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with database querying, preferably using tools such as BigQuery
Experience in working with ETLs and data pipelines
Proficiency in Python scripting for data manipulation and analysis
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate data into meaningful insights and recommendations
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience from working in a fast-paced environment where your skills depend on personal independence and agility
Experience with game analytics and an interest in playing games
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.

Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.

You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.

Who You Are

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.

You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we‚Äôre always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don‚Äôt require deep experience in all areas.
You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Proficiency in Swedish


What We Offer


Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

Title: Data Scientist - Generative AI / LLM
Description:
Job ID: 30401

We are looking for multiple data scientists or machine learning engineers focusing on generative AI for text, and Large Language Models.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

What you‚Äôll be doing:


Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications
Keep up to date with the latest AI developments to shape our Gen AI best practices and tooling
Document models and processes to ensure compliance and meet our compliance and risk management standards


The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki.

Who You Are

This is the right role if you have a passion to solve challenging problems - with the help of data, software and AI. As a person, you look past the noise, to do what is right. You prefer action to talking, but when you talk, people want to listen.

Your experience and background:


MSc or PhD in a field related to predictive or statistical modelling or software development.
At least 2 years‚Äô experience developing AI solutions in python, with a focus on rapid development and iteration.
Exposure to multiple AI projects using commercial grade LLM API's RAG, MCP, A2A.
A knack for tackling complex problems and creating simple solutions.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas and technology across domains.


It would be ideal if you also:


Experience from working on AWS
Experience developing production grade code
Experience with model explainability, monitoring and observability


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it‚Äôs to take their career to the next level. For others, it‚Äôs to break new ground within their area of expertise ‚Äì in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model ‚Äì we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/08/2025. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Bj√∂rn Hertzberg (bjorn.hertzberg@nordea.com).

The recruitment process consists of the following steps:


Preliminary CV selection
Phone conversation with the recruiter
Online interview with the hiring leader
Background check


At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do ‚Äì when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers‚Äô needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansf√∂rbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Us

At Legora, we‚Äôre on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, P√©rez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.

The role

Are you ready to take your AI career to the next level? At Legora, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize the legal industry with cutting-edge AI and LLM tech. We‚Äôre seeking an AI Engineer to join our face-moving team, where you‚Äôll work on technically difficult projects with the support of an amazing team, and help redefine how legal professionals work.

What You Will Be Doing


Architect and implement all AI and LLM features at Legora
Ensure we utilize the latest and greatest LLM features, agentic tools etc
Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
Own and drive forward PoCs and solve broad technical challenges


Who you are


A passionate software engineer with a few years of experience implementing and evaluating AI and LLM applicationsA strong coder: Proficient in languages like Python, with an emphasis on clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
You‚Äôre autonomous and take pride in the systems you architect
You‚Äôre a low ego, true team player
You‚Äôre a problem solver who‚Äôs not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about applied AI


What's in it for you


Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.

We‚Äôre not building for the way law is practiced today - we‚Äôre reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

Vad vi erbjuder

  • Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med n√•gra av de fr√§msta experterna inom AI och data och √∂ppna d√∂rren till nya arbetss√§tt som CollabAI.
  • Bra villkor och sociala aktiviteter! Gener√∂sa f√∂rm√•ner som konkurrenskraftig fast l√∂n, pension, 30 semesterdagar och mycket mer samt ett √∂ppet och inkluderande arbetsklimat d√§r vi v√§rnar om b√•de din personliga och professionella utveckling.


F√∂rm√•gor och erfarenheter f√∂r att lyckas i rollen

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Filed

Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America‚Äôs accounting firms. This industry might seem boring‚Äîbut it‚Äôs a $70B backbone of the economy that‚Äôs breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We‚Äôre fixing it‚Äîfast.

In just 9 months, we‚Äôve hit strong product-market fit, are generating fast-growing, sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We‚Äôre not a tool‚Äîwe‚Äôre the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We‚Äôre building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say ‚ÄúI was there when it all started.‚Äù

‚∏ª

Here‚Äôs Why This Is a Terrible Job

This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.

We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we‚Äôre going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we‚Äôre going in the right direction.

If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there‚Äôs already a handful of team members blocked behind you.

We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours‚Äînot quarters.

You‚Äôll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.

There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.

You‚Äôll ask yourself, is this really the work?

It is. And it‚Äôs not for everyone.

‚∏ª

Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make

We‚Äôre hyperscaling. We‚Äôre very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.

We‚Äôre building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.

We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.

You‚Äôll be paid above market. You‚Äôll earn equity that grows fast.

And you‚Äôll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.

You‚Äôll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.

You‚Äôll talk to users weekly. You‚Äôll drive outcomes end to end.

We‚Äôll tell you the goal. How you reach it‚Äîprompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data‚Äîis up to you.

We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.

That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.

‚∏ª

The Teammate We're Looking For


Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
No research-for-research‚Äôs-sake ‚Äî we ship fast and learn even faster
Big bonus if you‚Äôve shipped AI products into production, not just demos


‚∏ª

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For


Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
Building agentic frameworks (adk, langchain, crewai and the likes)
Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head


‚∏ª

Your Hard Skillset


Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood‚Äîbeyond the hype
Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
Comfortable working across Python beyond notebooks and can write production worthy services that handle millions of complicated documents and
Experience with cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
Bonus if you‚Äôve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals


‚∏ª

Your Soft Skillset


Ruthlessly pragmatic‚Äîknows when to ship and when to iterate
Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
Obsessively curious‚Äîyou want to understand everything about the domain you‚Äôre automating
You own your outcomes‚Äîand love having your work in front of real users daily


‚∏ª

Growth And Levels

We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.

We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.

This isn‚Äôt a comfy AI role. It‚Äôs fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.

You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.

‚∏ª

The process


Quick intro call
Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
Final round with our team
Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
Then we decide together if this is the right fight


‚∏ª

If you want to work with real users, real constraints, and build AI that goes far beyond chatbot demos‚Äîthis is it.

Compensation Range: $71.5K - $149.5K
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Stockholm - E-Commerce




We're working with a cutting-edge e-commerce startup backed by world-class investors. Our client is building a creative merchandising app that transforms how fashion and lifestyle brands curate their online stores.




They're now building a new product, a GPT-Search function for e-commerce stores and are looking for an ML Engineer to drive this product and take ownership.




What you‚Äôll do

Lead the design and development of a new AI-powered search tool that replaces traditional search bars with a smart, conversational interface.
Build and improve systems like RAG pipelines, semantic search, reranking, and personalisation for e-commerce.
Quickly prototype and launch features based on real feedback from merchants and shoppers.
Work closely with founders, product managers, and engineers to create a seamless shopping experience.
Take full ownership of machine learning components‚Äîfrom testing ideas to deploying them‚Äîincluding prompt design, fine-tuning, evaluation, and speed optimisation.
Explore new models and APIs to find the best balance between performance, cost, and user experience.
Help shape how the AI system adapts to different merchants, balancing automation with brand-specific customisation.
Play a key role in shaping the team‚Äôs engineering culture‚Äîhow we experiment, learn, and move fast together.




Who you are

You think like a founder‚Äîcomfortable building quick prototypes, taking on different roles, and navigating uncertainty.
You're excited about the fast-moving world of AI, especially LLMs, vector search, and conversational interfaces, and want to apply them in real products.
You‚Äôve worked on machine learning products in production, ideally involving smart search, personalised results, or large-scale model use.
You thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities shift and builders make the biggest impact.
You care more about making things happen than following rigid processes
You‚Äôre practical‚Äîyou‚Äôll test prompts before training models and launch early versions before perfecting them.
Bonus points if you‚Äôve worked on e-commerce search, fine-tuned foundation models, or used tools like FAISS, Weaviate, LangChain, or OpenAI APIs.




In Return

Competitive salary and equity
4000 SEK in annual wellness allowance
30 paid vacation days
Work from our office in Stockholm or full-time remote
Monthly co-working allowance if remote-based
Annual learning allowance
Company Laptop
Fun Quarterly off-sites




This is a great opportunity to be part of a financially secure and solid working culture where you can make a significant impact on this product and its growth.




Apply now or contact me for more information.




j.wright@tenthrevolution.com

+46 77 586 81 88

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Role: AI Engineer

Location: Stockholm (Hybrid) or Remote within the Nordic region

Job Type: Permanent, Full-time

Salary: Dependent on experience




The Opportunity

We‚Äôre working with a fast-growing, VC-backed Fintech company on a mission to transform how modern finance teams operate. Following a recent $16M funding round, they‚Äôre scaling an AI-powered platform designed to radically simplify workflows for accountants and finance professionals. At the heart of their product is intelligent automation, redefining back-office operations through seamless technology.

They‚Äôre now looking for an AI Engineer to join the team and help build smart, intuitive features that bring automation and intelligence to complex, manual workflows, delivering production-ready software that scales with real-world use.







What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As an AI Engineer, you‚Äôll work at the intersection of AI innovation and real-world application. Collaborating closely with engineers, designers, and product managers, you‚Äôll design and deploy intelligent systems that drive measurable efficiency. In this role, you will:

Designing and implementing intelligent automation workflows across tax, finance, and compliance domains.
Building scalable knowledge systems for storing, retrieving, and reasoning over complex information.
Managing end-to-end AI pipelines, including prompts, vector databases, fine-tuned models, and evaluation frameworks.
Developing deep product and domain expertise to anticipate user needs and shape smarter solutions.
















What They‚Äôre Looking For

They‚Äôre after someone who‚Äôs not just technically excellent, but curious, creative, and excited by complexity. Ideally, you bring:




3+ years of hands-on commercial experience building AI-driven products in a product-based organisation (not a consultancy or academic setting).
Deep understanding of large language models at a foundational level - not just surface-level familiarity.
Background in Software Engineering or Data Science, with a strong foundation in writing production-quality code and solving real-world problems.
Strong Python skills with experience building or fine-tuning LLMs, managing model pipelines, and deploying solutions in production using modern cloud infrastructure (GCP or Azure)
Solid grasp of embeddings, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), structured retrieval, and production-grade inference.







Bonus Points For:

Bonus points for contributing to or building internal tools for model evaluation and debugging.
Experience with Typescript







Why Join?

Join an early stage company backed by top-tier investors and growing fast.
Work on a product that directly impacts how thousands of professionals work.
Collaborate with a team of ambitious, low-ego engineers, designers, and operators.
Competitive salary and equity.
Hybrid working model

Title: Senior Data Scientist/Data Engineer
Description:
At Veat, we‚Äôre building a network of smart fridges that serve freshly made, plant-forward meals across Stockholm. Every dish is developed and cooked in-house, stocked daily, and tracked in real time. We're combining food, tech, and sustainability to make good food available anywhere.

We're now hiring a Senior Data Scientist/Data Engineer to lead the systems behind it all - forecasting demand, optimising restocks, and helping us scale across Sweden and Europe.


What you'll do




You‚Äôll dive into a rich, real-world dataset - from fridge telemetry and restock patterns to customer behavior and sales trends - and turn it into machine learning models, scalable pipelines, and dashboards that power smarter decisions across the company.




Build and deploy ML models for demand forecasting and waste reduction (e.g. Prophet, LSTM)
Design scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
Optimize GCP infrastructure and automate data workflows
Create dashboards to track KPIs like sales efficiency, waste, and restock accuracy
Work with ops and marketing to guide smarter planning and growth




What we‚Äôre looking for




We‚Äôre looking for someone who is not only technically strong but also collaborative, curious, and motivated by the real-world impact. You enjoy turning complex data into clear decisions, working across teams, and building systems that scale. And if you're someone who cares about sustainability - or just really loves good food - you‚Äôll feel right at home at Veat.




Must-have skills

4+ years of experience in data science and engineering
Strong SQL and Python
Familiar with ETL orchestration tools
Solid GCP knowledge
Experience with BI tools
Leadership skills - you own your projects and support others




Nice-to-haves

ML pipelines with Vertex AI or Kubeflow
Experience with real-time data processing
BigQuery ML, Vertex AI experimentation


What we offer




An opportunity to join a delicious start-up that‚Äôs geared up for growth
Healthy lunches, breakfast and snacks, and lots of Veat tastings (!)
A meaningful way to contribute to a more nourishing and sustainable food system

We're now hiring a Senior Data Scientist/Data Engineer to lead the systems behind it all - forecasting demand, optimising restocks, and helping us scale across Sweden and Europe.

What you'll do


You‚Äôll dive into a rich, real-world dataset - from fridge telemetry and restock patterns to customer behavior and sales trends - and turn it into machine learning models, scalable pipelines, and dashboards that power smarter decisions across the company.


  • Build and deploy ML models for demand forecasting and waste reduction (e.g. Prophet, LSTM)
  • Design scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
  • Optimize GCP infrastructure and automate data workflows
  • Create dashboards to track KPIs like sales efficiency, waste, and restock accuracy
  • Work with ops and marketing to guide smarter planning and growth


What we‚Äôre looking for


We‚Äôre looking for someone who is not only technically strong but also collaborative, curious, and motivated by the real-world impact. You enjoy turning complex data into clear decisions, working across teams, and building systems that scale. And if you're someone who cares about sustainability - or just really loves good food - you‚Äôll feel right at home at Veat.


Must-have skills

  • 4+ years of experience in data science and engineering
  • Strong SQL and Python
  • Familiar with ETL orchestration tools
  • Solid GCP knowledge
  • Experience with BI tools
  • Leadership skills - you own your projects and support others


Nice-to-haves

  • ML pipelines with Vertex AI or Kubeflow
  • Experience with real-time data processing
  • BigQuery ML, Vertex AI experimentation

    • What we offer


    • An opportunity to join a delicious start-up that‚Äôs geared up for growth
    • Healthy lunches, breakfast and snacks, and lots of Veat tastings (!)
    • A meaningful way to contribute to a more nourishing and sustainable food system

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist, Merchant Analytics
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Merchant Group At Wolt

Wolt as a platform focuses on serving three main groups: customers, couriers, and merchants. In a nutshell, the Merchant Group strives to make Wolt an integral part of our Merchant‚Äôs daily business. Their core mission is to provide merchants with self-service tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use.

About The Merchant Analytics Team

Merchant Analytics is an embedded analytics function within the Merchant Group. The team works to unlock insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations that drive the success of merchants at Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects that can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt‚Äôs marketplace strategy.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
4-5+ years of experience in an analytics or data science position within an industry or research setting.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and causal inference using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Please note that we might have delays due to the peak holiday season.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:

Vill du ha en roll d√§r du kan anv√§nda din analytiska kompetens f√∂r att g√∂ra verklig skillnad? Vi s√∂ker en erfaren Lead Data Scientist som vill leda utvecklingen inom AI och ML ‚Äì hos n√•gra av Sveriges mest sp√§nnande bolag.

Vi s√∂ker dig som b√•de har djup teknisk kompetens och f√∂rm√•gan att se det st√∂rre perspektivet ‚Äì att koppla analys till faktiska aff√§rsresultat.







Vad Du F√•r Hos Oss

P√•verkan p√• riktigt ‚Äì var med och forma strategi, processer och beslut hos Sveriges mest intressanta f√∂retag.
Ett skarpt team ‚Äì jobba med drivna och kunniga kollegor som brinner f√∂r AI/ML och avancerad analys.

Vi Tror Att Du Har
