Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer required to join a fast-scaling technology business backed by a global platform, currently looking to expand a specialist unit of engineers.




This elite team of engineers operates like a start-up, combining deep technical expertise with the agility needed to build a next-generation platform capable of processing millions of data events annually. They‚Äôre creating intelligent, real-time user experiences using advanced analytics, cloud-native development, and high-performance systems.

The Role

As part of this team, you‚Äôll sit at the intersection of software engineering and quantitative modelling-ensuring machine learning models and algorithms are efficiently deployed, scaled, and maintained in production cloud environments.




You'll be contributing to a team where you can influence both product and technical decisions, working on complex challenges involving real-time data, personalisation engines, and distributed cloud systems.

Contribute to technical design discussions, code reviews, and system architecture improvements.

MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or a similar field (PhD in Mathematics is a plus).

Backed by a global business while retaining the pace and culture of a startup.

Title: Graduate Software Engineer (relocate to London)
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Master your toolkit. By working across diverse tech stacks, you‚Äôll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust‚Äîyou‚Äôll show that true expertise isn‚Äôt about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
Build stuff that matters. Regardless of your seniority, you‚Äôll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You‚Äôll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
Simplify relentlessly. Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future-proof solutions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

Title: Data Scientist II, AWS Managed Operations Data Science (MODS)
Description:
Jobright is an AI-powered career platform that helps job seekers discover the top opportunities in the US. We are NOT a staffing agency. Jobright does not hire directly for these positions. We connect you with verified openings from employers you can trust.




Job Summary:

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud. The AWS Managed Operations Data Science (MODS) Team is seeking a Data Scientist to drive data-driven transformation and provide insights that inform operations and engineering teams. This role involves managing the end-to-end data science lifecycle and collaborating with cross-functional teams to solve complex business problems.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Collaboration & Cross Functional Relationships: Interact with business and software teams to understand their business requirements and operational processes

‚Ä¢ Data Exploration and Analysis: Conduct in-depth exploratory data analysis to understand the structure, quality, and patterns within complex datasets. Apply statistical and machine learning techniques to extract insights, identify trends, and uncover hidden relationships in the data.

‚Ä¢ Business Insights and Recommendations: Frame business problems into scalable solutions; translate complex data insights and model outputs into actionable recommendations that address the organization's strategic objectives.

‚Ä¢ Data Pipeline and Infrastructure: Contribute to the design and implementation of data pipelines, data lakes, and other data infrastructure components to support the organization's data-driven initiatives.

‚Ä¢ Metric Development and Monitoring: Define and develop advanced, customized metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) that capture the nuances of the organization's strategic objectives and operational complexities. Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance of metrics

‚Ä¢ Prototype models by using high-level modeling languages such as R or in software languages such as Python. A software team will be working with you to transform prototypes into production.

‚Ä¢ Documentation & Continuous Improvement: Create, enhance, and maintain technical documentation




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of data scientist experience

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab, etc.) experience

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of machine learning/statistical modeling data analysis tools and techniques, and parameters that affect their performance experience

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of relevant statistical measures such as confidence intervals, significance of error measurements, development and evaluation data sets, etc.

‚Ä¢ Master's Degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, or a related quantitative field with 2+ years' experience in Data Science or related Science discipline, OR, Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, or a related quantitative field with 5+ years' experience in Data Science or related Science discipline




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ 6+ years of data scientist experience

‚Ä¢ 4+ years of machine learning, statistical modeling, data mining, and analytics techniques experience

‚Ä¢ Experience with data scripting languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R, or equivalent) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g., R, SAS, Matlab, or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ Experience with clustered data processing (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Map-reduce, and Hive)

‚Ä¢ Experience in a ML or data scientist role with a large technology company




Company:

Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) began exposing key infrastructure services to businesses in the form of web services -- now widely known as cloud computing. Founded in 2002, headquartered in Seattle, Washington, USA, team size 10001+ employees, currently Late Stage.

Title: Jr. Designer
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for NBCUniversal. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('Versant') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.

Role

NBCE Late Night Brand Marketing & Consumer Engagement is looking for an entry level digital designer who will help lead efforts in creating social media design elements across NBCE late night shows. The candidate will develop and produce content for a multitude of social platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube and TikTok and should possess expert skills with After Effects, Premiere, Photoshop, and Illustrator. This role will develop strong relationships with show teams while working seamlessly within the digital team to deliver on daily show assets and needs.

The ideal candidate has strong creative, conceptual, and producing skills along with on-platform experience. This role requires cross-functional collaboration with the ability to deliver on a variety of projects simultaneously. They are hyper-enthusiastic about ever-evolving digital/social trends and are excited about the brands. This role requires non-traditional working hours at times, with flexibility as an important foundation for success. This role reports to the Senior Designer under Late Night, Brand Marketing & Consumer Engagement.

Primary Responsibilities


Design social elements across NBCE late night properties with a focus on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube
Create digital branding for shows across all platforms, including style guide for brand standards.
Edit existing templates of static and motion graphics, create new templates when necessary for future use.
Edit a variety of video projects, including compilations of existing show content and original shorts, utilizing graphics and transitions effectively with an intuitive understanding of comedic timing
Communicate effectively and efficiently with staff and internal teams
Work in close partnership with social leads and strategy for all late night shows
Understand and identify trends within the space and execute within each show's brand and with social goals in mind.
Work on-the-go, adjust to last-minute changes and unexpected opportunities, and hurtles while still delivering best-in-class social content


Basic Requirements/Qualification


1-2 years experience
Expert in After Effects, Premiere, Photoshop, and Illustrator a must.
Experience working in a GFX team in a digital agency or network/TV environment a plus
Working knowledge of social platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and TikTok and YouTube a must.
Experience with photography, video and audio production a plus.
Experience with illustration and 3D design a plus.
Core understanding of designing for mobile, social and emerging platforms a plus
Exhibits strategic thinking skills and good judgment
Good interpersonal skills
Has a firm grasp of on-set etiquette
Detailed oriented to deliver high-quality, accurate work
Experience with filming, shooting photos, and editing on mobile devices a plus.


Additional Requirements


Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.
This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page (https://www.nbcunicareers.com/benefits) of the Careers website.


Salary range: $50,000 - $65,000

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Software Engineer, Entry Level
Description:
Jobright is an AI-powered career platform that helps job seekers discover the top opportunities in the US. We are NOT a staffing agency. Jobright does not hire directly for these positions. We connect you with verified openings from employers you can trust.




Job Summary:

Blackhawk Network is a leading provider of branded payment solutions, helping businesses grow revenue and engage consumers through their global platform. They are seeking a Software Engineer to plan, design, and develop next-generation software components, perform front-end and server-side development, and mentor junior team members.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Plan, design, and develop next generation system and software components.

Title: AI Demo Engineer [32474]
Description:
About Us

We are a cutting-edge AI company delivering enterprise-grade machine learning solutions to leading organizations worldwide. Our platform enables clients to deploy AI at scale, unlocking innovation and driving measurable results.




Role Overview

We are seeking an AI Demo Engineer who can combine strong technical expertise with excellent communication skills. You will design and deliver engaging demonstrations of our AI platform, helping clients visualize and understand its capabilities.

This role is perfect for someone with a technical foundation who enjoys client interaction, storytelling with data, and working in a fast-paced AI environment.




Responsibilities

Create, customize, and present compelling AI demos to prospective clients.
Collaborate with sales and product teams to understand client needs.
Translate complex AI/ML concepts into simple, engaging explanations.
Collect client feedback to improve demo effectiveness.
Stay updated on AI/ML trends and competitive products.




Requirements

2+ years of experience in a technical role (AI/ML, Data Science, Pre-Sales Engineering, or similar).
Strong communication and presentation skills in English.
Solid understanding of AI/ML concepts (no requirement to be a traditional Data Scientist).
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field (preferred).
Ability to work across US/Canada time zones.




Preferred but not required:

Experience as a Customer-Facing Data Scientist, Demo Engineer, or Solutions Architect.
Experience with platforms like DataRobot or competitive AI tools.
Kaggle competition participation is a plus.

Title: Software Developer Intern
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Kimley-Horn. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Overview

Kimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine‚Äôs ‚Äú100 Best Companies to Work For,‚Äù is looking for a Software Developer Intern to join the corporate team in our Raleigh office. The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic and a desire to expand technical skills.

This is an in-office position during Summer 2026.

Responsibilities


Support development of existing and emerging software products in Kimley-Horn‚Äôs portfolio.
Work with team members and business partners to understand and design project requirements and enhancements based on business and user needs
Develop applications and creative solutions based on project requirements
Apply bug fixes and enhancements to existing solutions
Implement and support applications post deployment
Quickly evaluate bugs, and apply fixes to resolve issues
Understand and apply best practices; remain knowledgeable of trends in the software development industry


Qualifications


Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology/Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Self-starter who works well with minimal supervision
Natural collaborator with strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent communication and client service skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to excel within an iterative development environment


Preferred Technical Experience


Web development languages and frameworks (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Typescript, Angular)
Relational and Non-Relational database design and development (MS SQL Server, NoSQL)
Object-oriented programming (C#, .NET)


Office hours are 7:30am ‚Äì 5:30pm Monday ‚Äì Thursday and 7:30am ‚Äì 11:30am Friday.

Why Kimley-Horn?

At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. People, clients and employees, are at the forefront of who we are. Clients know we prioritize achieving their goals and growing their success. Employees know our culture and approach to business are built on a desire to provide an environment for everyone to flourish. Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it‚Äî that‚Äôs why we welcome and develop passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. We take pride in how our employee retention, robust benefits package, and company values have led to Kimley-Horn‚Äôs placement on the Fortune ‚Äú100 Best Companies to Work‚Äù list for 17 years!

Title: SHE Specialist
Description:
Activate your potential - join NORIT, the world leader in activated carbon production!‚ÄØ¬†

Join us as a SH&E Specialist in Marshall¬†to drive workplace safety and environmental excellence in manufacturing plant. In this role, you'll lead incident investigations, drive continuous improvement, and collaborate across departments to ensure compliance with all SH&E standards and regulations.

Your key responsibilities will be:

Responsible for preparing and submitting after review with SH&E Manager all regulatory reporting including Tier II Reporting, Environmental Inventory Questionnaires (EIQ), and other environmental, health and safety reports identified,
Assists with monitoring proposed and existing SH&E regulations and legislation to determine their impact on operations. Assists with development and implementation of programs to ensure continued compliance with all applicable plant, company, state and federal policies, regulations, and legislation,
Assists with maintaining and establishing as required, SH&E monitoring programs to ensure all activities meet established safety requirements.,
Assists with maintaining site records for occupational and environmental health and safety including documentation on training and certifications,
Works with SH&E Manager and Management Team to develop and implement training and other programs and activities necessary to ensure facility SH&E compliance,
Observe and evaluate workplace environments, equipment, or practices to ensure compliance with company safety standards as well as all local, state, and federal guidelines,
Assists with SH&E training from reporting, tracking, maintaining, developing, and providing training,
As needed assists with new-employee environmental, health and safety orientations,
Assists with driving continuous improvement through trend reporting analysis and metrics management,
Leads and participates in investigating, recording, and reporting undesired SH&E events. Works with SH&E Manager and Management Team to ensure corrective actions are taken to fulfill regulatory compliance. Maintains/Improves current accident and incident reporting system for all employees,
Performs periodic safety inspections and compliance audits,
Assists SH&E Manager with creating programs that promote employee health and wellness,
Provides regular communication to SH&E Manager regarding issues and performance to ensure that relevant issues are quickly and appropriately addressed,
Prepares, leads, and participates in Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) sessions. Ensures carried out on schedule and action items are carried out as required based on the analysis,
Assists with and carries out actions required for the Industrial Hygiene Management Program,
Assists with maintaining all OSHA Recordkeeping Requirements,
Effectively perform and communicate Root Cause Analysis,
Coordinates and oversees Site Security,
Performs inspections of off-site landfill and lagoon
Performs required activities associated with off-site lagoon discharge
Abide by and assist with enforcing all organizational policies and procedures, and,
Assists with maintaining records and documentation related to SH&E activities, including ensuring procedures are continuously updated



Requirements


Bachelor of Science Degree in Occupational, Safety and Health, Safety Engineering or Related Field and 7+ years of related experience,
2+ years of experience in a manufacturing facility,
Strong communication skills,
Strong analytical skills, ability to gather, analyze and draw well-reasoned conclusions,
Proven ability to influence actions and mindsets,
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills,
Highly organized and strong time management skills, and
Ability to motivate and oversee work of direct and indirect reports



Benefits


Competitive salary and additional benefit package,¬†
Supportive and dynamic, yet down-to-earth work environment,¬†
A flat organization with short lines in which ownership and initiatives are valued,¬†
We support the development of our employees in the form of on-the-job learning, training and courses.¬†


About NORIT Activated Carbon

NORIT Activated Carbon is one of the global leaders and produces various qualities of activated carbon in its powder and granular form. Our mission - to be the customer's #1 choice for added value activated carbon solutions in energy, environmental, water, food, chemical, pharma, automotive, and other industrial markets. We supply a broad portfolio of materials, know-how and technical expertise, complementary services and technologies.¬†

We have established our global presence with manufacturing plants in the Netherlands, United Kingdom, Italy and United States and as well a Global Business Service center in Riga.¬†¬†

Show more
HTML:
Activate your potential - join NORIT, the world leader in activated carbon production!‚ÄØ 

Join us as a SH&E Specialist in Marshall to drive workplace safety and environmental excellence in manufacturing plant. In this role, you'll lead incident investigations, drive continuous improvement, and collaborate across departments to ensure compliance with all SH&E standards and regulations.

Your key responsibilities will be:

  • Responsible for preparing and submitting after review with SH&E Manager all regulatory reporting including Tier II Reporting, Environmental Inventory Questionnaires (EIQ), and other environmental, health and safety reports identified,
  • Assists with monitoring proposed and existing SH&E regulations and legislation to determine their impact on operations. Assists with development and implementation of programs to ensure continued compliance with all applicable plant, company, state and federal policies, regulations, and legislation,
  • Assists with maintaining and establishing as required, SH&E monitoring programs to ensure all activities meet established safety requirements.,
  • Assists with maintaining site records for occupational and environmental health and safety including documentation on training and certifications,
  • Works with SH&E Manager and Management Team to develop and implement training and other programs and activities necessary to ensure facility SH&E compliance,
  • Observe and evaluate workplace environments, equipment, or practices to ensure compliance with company safety standards as well as all local, state, and federal guidelines,
  • Assists with SH&E training from reporting, tracking, maintaining, developing, and providing training,
  • As needed assists with new-employee environmental, health and safety orientations,
  • Assists with driving continuous improvement through trend reporting analysis and metrics management,
  • Leads and participates in investigating, recording, and reporting undesired SH&E events. Works with SH&E Manager and Management Team to ensure corrective actions are taken to fulfill regulatory compliance. Maintains/Improves current accident and incident reporting system for all employees,
  • Performs periodic safety inspections and compliance audits,
  • Assists SH&E Manager with creating programs that promote employee health and wellness,
  • Provides regular communication to SH&E Manager regarding issues and performance to ensure that relevant issues are quickly and appropriately addressed,
  • Prepares, leads, and participates in Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) sessions. Ensures carried out on schedule and action items are carried out as required based on the analysis,
  • Assists with and carries out actions required for the Industrial Hygiene Management Program,
  • Assists with maintaining all OSHA Recordkeeping Requirements,
  • Effectively perform and communicate Root Cause Analysis,
  • Coordinates and oversees Site Security,
  • Performs inspections of off-site landfill and lagoon
  • Performs required activities associated with off-site lagoon discharge
  • Abide by and assist with enforcing all organizational policies and procedures, and,
  • Assists with maintaining records and documentation related to SH&E activities, including ensuring procedures are continuously updated


Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science Degree in Occupational, Safety and Health, Safety Engineering or Related Field and 7+ years of related experience,
  • 2+ years of experience in a manufacturing facility,
  • Strong communication skills,
  • Strong analytical skills, ability to gather, analyze and draw well-reasoned conclusions,
  • Proven ability to influence actions and mindsets,
  • Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills,
  • Highly organized and strong time management skills, and
  • Ability to motivate and oversee work of direct and indirect reports


Benefits

  • Competitive salary and additional benefit package, 
  • Supportive and dynamic, yet down-to-earth work environment, 
  • A flat organization with short lines in which ownership and initiatives are valued, 
  • We support the development of our employees in the form of on-the-job learning, training and courses. 

About NORIT Activated Carbon

NORIT Activated Carbon is one of the global leaders and produces various qualities of activated carbon in its powder and granular form. Our mission - to be the customer's #1 choice for added value activated carbon solutions in energy, environmental, water, food, chemical, pharma, automotive, and other industrial markets. We supply a broad portfolio of materials, know-how and technical expertise, complementary services and technologies. 

We have established our global presence with manufacturing plants in the Netherlands, United Kingdom, Italy and United States and as well a Global Business Service center in Riga.

Title: Wellness Response Partner
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for META. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Summary

Meta is seeking a Wellness Response Partner to join our Wellness Response Team, under the Psychological Health, Strategy and Response function. This role offers a unique opportunity to work with and support a wide variety of teams around the world to triage and provide hands-on support for any employee experiencing thoughts of potential harm to self, harm to others, and other escalated mental health matters. The individual hired will have impact not only on the person(s) at risk, but on the company's growth and the psychological health of its people. Candidates should have a psychology, counseling, or crisis response background with proven experience assessing different types of risk, and bringing creative and effective ideas and solutions to a growing organization. Large-scale operation program management skills are highly desirable.

Required Skills

Wellness Response Partner Responsibilities:


Respond to and lead in the resolution of reported wellness response incidents quickly, and with empathy, connecting individuals impacted to the right resources
Intakes, triages, manages, and aligns cross-functional resources to address all Wellness Response cases appropriately
Provide rotational on-call coverage, covering weekends and holidays, ensuring 24/7/365 wellness response support
Help design and deliver targeted solutions with a high degree of focus on scale and growth, including strategic planning on people processes and change management
Provides direction, guidance, and thought partnership to all levels of the organization, by proactively assessing root cause trends, making recommendations, and partnering with cross-functional partners to implement appropriate solutions
Helps balance wellbeing and risk, taking into account employee, business and company perspectives
Help design and facilitate Manager/Partner Training based on data analysis and business need
Integrate and partner with HR, Legal, Investigations, Learning & Development, and Security, and other key partners to implement solutions and help scale the business
Partner closely with regional and global cross-functional partners to triage and execute solutions
Be prepared to influence large strategic priorities and coordinate across all stakeholders (internal and external) as needed to ensure the right design, execution, communication and resources are in place to deliver the key milestones
Participate and lead projects as an integral member of the extended HR community and influence others within the organization
Build collaborative and productive working relationships
Lead with integrity, respect, high personal standards and builds personal credibility
Build internal community (e.g. support others, show respect, onboard new hires, connect people, collaborate well, drive sense of community)
Actively involved in interviewing and on-boarding new employees


Minimum Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:


12+ years of clinical experience/direct care in Psychology, Counseling, and/or Crisis Response
Masters degree in psychology, behavioral health, mental health and/or equivalent
Hold accreditation/registration/practitioner status with the State or Governmental agency with responsibility for regulating the practice in their field. For US: Licensed as Psychologist, LCSW, LPC or equivalent
Demonstrates astute clinical skill and knowledge in crisis management, risk assessment, psychopathology, and occupational health matters
Demonstrates experience with working with a global population
Demonstrates judgment and proven experience assessing risk relative to individual health and the business
Demonstrates effective communication and critical thinking skills
Demonstrates empathy and has experience driving inclusive work
Demonstrates project management and change management experience
Experience working independently with minimum supervision and make decisions involving various groups, locations, and partners
Demonstrated experience learning and thriving in a constantly changing environment to cultivate relationships across teams
Experience helping global and/or matrix organizations scale
Demonstrated experience in influencing and strategically solving problems
Consulting, coaching and facilitation skills


Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications:


Doctoral degree in psychology, counseling, social work, or related-behavioral sciences field


Public Compensation

$174,000/year to $245,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Industry: Internet

Equal Opportunity

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Position Description

Join CGI Federal as a Junior Business Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to transform the financial legacy system for a major US Federal government agency with the cutting-edge Momentum ERP. This full-time role offers a vibrant and welcoming environment where innovation and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. If you're curious and eager to grow, this is the perfect place for you!

You'll be part of a dynamic team, with endless opportunities to learn and develop as you contribute to delivering impactful solutions for our client.

This position is available at the Lafayette, LA, Belton, Texas, Knoxville, TN offices with the flexibility of a hybrid working model. (Must be a US Citizen or GC / Permanent Resident) Step into a role where your potential is nurtured, and your contributions are valued!

This position requires US citizenship or Green Card/Permanent resident status.

Your Future Duties And Responsibilities


Collaborate with client stakeholders to grasp their business processes and define requirements for innovative solutions.
Take initiative in problem-solving, owning research, recommending solutions, and executing resolutions for client challenges.
Support testing by creating test scenarios, documenting processes, and performing validation testing.
Assist in implementation activities, including analyzing requirements and developing design and configuration documentation.
Engage directly with clients on-site to enhance their experience and support their use of the new system.


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role


Bachelor's degree.
Strong curiosity and eagerness to learn, with a proactive "can do" attitude for team efforts.
Analytical mindset with a knack for solving problems and developing solutions. Love solving puzzles? Bring your analytical skills to tackle challenges and craft smart solutions.
Comfortable speaking up and asking questions to enhance understanding in group settings.
Enthusiastic about working directly with clients to help them adapt to new systems and processes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Skilled at managing workload, juggling multiple priorities, and resolving conflicts effectively.


Desired Qualifications/non-essential Skills Required


Understanding of basic accounting practices and principles
Willingness and ability to travel within the US
Familiarity with Agile working environments.

Title: Engineer I, R&D
Description:
Additional Location(s): N/A

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we‚Äôll give you the opportunity to harness all that‚Äôs within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we‚Äôll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you‚Äôll be supported in progressing ‚Äì whatever your ambitions.

About The Role

The Ablation Catheter Development Team is growing and has an exciting opportunity for an entry-level engineer role supporting electrophysiology product development within the Cardiology division. Electrophysiology is an exciting growth driver for BSC. With the acquisition of FARAPULSE Inc., Boston Scientific will strengthen its leadership in Personalized EP Solutions, with a strong focus in Atrial Fibrillation. The entry-level engineer role will be a key team member in providing mechanical engineering support in the creation and development of new electrophysiology ablation catheter technologies.

As R&D Engineer I, you will support new product development team solutions to multi-faceted customer issues. You will be a part of a high-performance team responsible for the design, implementation, and test of disposable medical devices within our electrophysiology pulsed field ablation single use device portfolio. This critical role will be a part of best-in-class development practices and rigorous, holistic product design in coordination with internal and external partners.

Key Responsibilities


Researches, develops, designs, and evaluates: mechanical and electro-mechanical materials, components, assemblies, processes and/or equipment.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of problem-solving processes and tools to assist in root cause analysis of complex engineering problems. Gathers and communicates information to help identify/solve problems.
Approaches problems analytically, methodically, and systematically.
Leverages internal/external partners as necessary to achieve project objectives.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of technical aspects of complex single use device development including requirements, design, implementation, test, integration, transfer to manufacturing, and verification/validation.
Learns and performs the basics of data collection, organization, and preliminary analysis. Demonstrates basic knowledge of analytical techniques and tools.
Understands basic test methods, work instructions, protocols, and executes accordingly.
Solves system problems by analyzing the situation and recommending corrective or alternative actions. Facilitates crisp decision making around key technical issues.
Plans and organizes project assignments of substantial variety and complexity. Provides clear communication to project leads or mentors.
Ensure quality system compliance for medical device development, champion continuous improvement, and adopt best practices.
Creates a strong team culture around high expectations and high performance
Maintains detailed documentation throughout all phases of research and development.


Required Qualifications


BS degree in Mechanical Engineering
Strong Design/Technical focus in Mechanical engineering. Demonstrates a good understanding of the fundamentals of Design.
Experience with SOLIDWORKS, Solid Edge, MATLAB, Python
0-1 years of prior experience (or similar through internships/co-ops) in Research and Development
Strong Design/Technical focus in Mechanical engineering. Demonstrates a good understanding of the fundamentals of Design.
Previous work or internship experience with Boston Scientific


Preferred Qualifications


Proven self-starter who runs towards critical issues, ambiguous requirements, or loosely defined challenges with a demonstrated ability to rally teams to achieve business results.
Basic knowledge with Electrophysiology and/or Class II or Class III Medical Device products
Demonstrates product development and communication skills.
Ability to draw conclusions and make recommendations based on technical inputs from multiple and varied sources.
Basic understanding of working within a quality system, IEC and ISO standards relevant to medical device lifecycle and risk management (i.e., ISO 13485).
Takes initiative, has a motivation to learn and shows willingness to ask questions.
Strong written and oral communication skills
Passion for understanding and solving problems for end users


Requisition ID: 611701

Minimum Salary: $ 58200

Maximum Salary: $ 110500

The anticipated compensation listed above and the value of core and optional employee benefits offered by Boston Scientific (BSC) ‚Äì see www.bscbenefitsconnect.com--will vary based on actual location of the position and other pertinent factors considered in determining actual compensation for the role. Compensation will be commensurate with demonstrable level of experience and training, pertinent education including licensure and certifications, among other relevant business or organizational needs. At BSC, it is not typical for an individual to be hired near the bottom or top of the anticipated salary range listed above.

Compensation for non-exempt (hourly), non-sales roles may also include variable compensation from time to time (e.g., any overtime and shift differential) and annual bonus target (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements).

Compensation for exempt, non-sales roles may also include variable compensation, i.e., annual bonus target and long-term incentives (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements).

For MA positions: It is unlawful to require or administer a lie detector test for employment. Violators are subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most ‚Äì united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do ‚Äì as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn‚Äôt just business, it‚Äôs personal. And if you‚Äôre a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve.

Boston Scientific Corporation has been and will continue to be an equal opportunity employer. To ensure full implementation of its equal employment policy, the Company will continue to take steps to assure that recruitment, hiring, assignment, promotion, compensation, and all other personnel decisions are made and administered without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, gender expression, veteran status, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information or any other protected class.

Please be advised that certain US based positions, including without limitation field sales and service positions that call on hospitals and/or health care centers, require acceptable proof of COVID-19 vaccination status. Candidates will be notified during the interview and selection process if the role(s) for which they have applied require proof of vaccination as a condition of employment. Boston Scientific continues to evaluate its policies and protocols regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and will comply with all applicable state and federal law and healthcare credentialing requirements. As employees of the Company, you will be expected to meet the ongoing requirements for your roles, including any new requirements, should the Company‚Äôs policies or protocols change with regard to COVID-19 vaccination.

Among other requirements, Boston Scientific maintains specific prohibited substance test requirements for safety-sensitive positions. This role is deemed safety-sensitive and, as such, candidates will be subject to a prohibited substance test as a requirement. The goal of the prohibited substance testing is to increase workplace safety in compliance with the applicable law.

Title: Mid-level Data Scientist ‚Äì Applied AI (B2C)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

From millions of reviews to rich user interaction data, we have a vast amount of behavioral and content data that powers our consumer platform. In the B2C Applied AI team, we‚Äôre focused on leveraging AI and ML to improve how people discover, interact with, and trust businesses on Trustpilot.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our B2C Applied AI team to build intelligent, data-driven product features that improve user experience and deliver business impact. You will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and ML engineers to develop and maintain impactful AI/ML models at scale.

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning solutions, especially in areas such as ranking, search, recommendations, and personalization. You‚Äôll also demonstrate a strong understanding of user behavior data and how to use it to influence product development. A product mindset and ability to work cross-functionally are essential.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Great opportunity to make a real product impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
Work on some of our most exciting Data Science initiatives aimed at improving the Trustpilot consumer experience: from ranking and recommendations to natural language processing and search.
Build, deploy, and maintain production-ready ML models that directly power features used by millions of users.
Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to develop user-facing features informed by ML and experimentation.
Use data and model insights to identify new opportunities for personalization and discovery across our platform.
Take ownership of specific ML features or components and drive them from concept to production and iteration.
Work with leading tools such as GCP Vertex AI, BigQuery, Airflow, and emerging ML technologies.
Be a part of a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace that encourages learning and growth.


Who You Are


Experience working in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, ideally on consumer-facing products like search, ranking, recommendations, personalization, or discovery.
Strong hands-on ability with ML modeling, including semantic search, ranking algorithms, clustering, recommendation systems, and natural language processing (NLP), with a track record of deploying models to production.
Strong skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and computational problem-solving; ideally with a background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
Comfortable working with large-scale data and behavioral/user interaction data, and using it to build impactful, data-driven product features.
Proficient in Python and SQL, and confident working across the full ML lifecycle from exploration to deployment.
Experience with cloud platforms like GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure, and tools such as BigQuery, Vertex AI, and Airflow.
Familiarity with ML production tooling and infrastructure, including CI/CD workflows.
Comfortable using metrics to monitor, iterate, and improve model performance.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî able to engage clearly and effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Collaborative and agile‚Äî experienced in working closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers within cross-functional teams to create impactful solutions.
You take ownership, move quickly, and are driven to solve real user problems with scalable, measurable, and maintainable solutions.


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It‚Äôs complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever ‚Äî to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial ‚Äî we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we‚Äôre headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We‚Äôre driven by connection. It‚Äôs at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh ‚Äì‚Äì it‚Äôs built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We‚Äôre a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you ‚Äì‚Äì we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you‚Äôre ready to grow, let‚Äôs go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

HTML:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

From millions of reviews to rich user interaction data, we have a vast amount of behavioral and content data that powers our consumer platform. In the B2C Applied AI team, we‚Äôre focused on leveraging AI and ML to improve how people discover, interact with, and trust businesses on Trustpilot.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our B2C Applied AI team to build intelligent, data-driven product features that improve user experience and deliver business impact. You will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and ML engineers to develop and maintain impactful AI/ML models at scale.

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning solutions, especially in areas such as ranking, search, recommendations, and personalization. You‚Äôll also demonstrate a strong understanding of user behavior data and how to use it to influence product development. A product mindset and ability to work cross-functionally are essential.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Great opportunity to make a real product impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
  • Work on some of our most exciting Data Science initiatives aimed at improving the Trustpilot consumer experience: from ranking and recommendations to natural language processing and search.
  • Build, deploy, and maintain production-ready ML models that directly power features used by millions of users.

  • Be a part of a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace that encourages learning and growth.

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, develop, train, and evaluate deep learning models (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, etc.)
Collaborate with data scientists to understand business requirements and translate them into robust ML solutions
Optimize models for inference (e.g., quantization, pruning, ONNX, TensorRT)
Deploy models to production environments (e.g., via REST APIs, edge devices, or cloud platforms)
Conduct data preprocessing, augmentation, and exploratory data analysis
Maintain and improve MLOps pipelines for training, testing, and monitoring
Document experiments, results, and best practices for future reference

Requirements

Proven experience (3+ years) in deep learning and model deployment
Strong proficiency in Python and DL frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Familiarity with model versioning, reproducibility, and experiment tracking (MLflow, Weights & Biases)
Strong understanding of data structures, computer vision or NLP (depending on the project)
Solid background in mathematics/statistics (linear algebra, probability, optimization)
Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in a cross-functional team

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent

Industry: Financial Services / Capital Markets

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site 4 days/week)




About the Client:

We have partnered with a Danish company specialising in Algorithmic Trading. The company has been the market leader in automating financial markets since 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




About the role:

As part of this role, you‚Äôll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.




Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.




Candidate Profile:

PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Experience with the full machine learning development cycle‚Äîfrom data processing to deployment and monitoring
Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
Solid grasp of computer science principles
Analytical, scientific mindset
Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)




Bonus skills:

Experience handling large, complex datasets
Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++




What‚Äôs offered:

Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
Challenging, interesting problems to solve
Supportive and highly skilled team
Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data scientist with a passion for language, logic, and large language models

To support our continued growth and innovation, we are seeking a Data scientist to join our team in Aarhus. This is a unique opportunity to combine your love of language, structure, and data models, to help shape how we use LLMs, and other machine learning technologies in customer-facing solutions.

Who We Are

Founded in a garage in 2016 and now headquartered in the heart of Aarhus, Adversus is a fast-growing SaaS company with a talented team of +50 colleagues. We‚Äôve established ourselves as a leading provider of cloud-based call center software, serving customers in more than 35 countries across the globe. We build smart, scalable solutions‚Äîand we always seek new ways to work smarter, not harder.

What You Will Be Doing

As our Data Scientist, you will help design, test, evaluate and refine the technologies that drive accurate, useful, and creative outputs from machine learning models. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer-facing teams to ensure our AI features are reliable, effective, and aligned with real-world needs.

You will play a critical role in unlocking the full potential of AI across our platform, helping our customers with automated workflows, content creation, quality assurance, and improving their interactions with our platform.

How We See You


A structured thinker with a flair for language and logic
Familiar with tools like OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4, and prompt engineering best practices
Able to package AI interactions in a format suitable for API consumption.
A pragmatic engineer with a solid understanding of technology limits, but also keeping an eye on the opportunities
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
You‚Äôre fluent in English, both written and verbal.


Key Responsibilities


Craft, and iterate on effective inputs to power AI-driven features
Collaborate with development teams to integrate AI outputs into product workflows
Evaluate model behavior, identify edge cases, and propose improvements
Maintain libraries and documentation for internal use
Explore fine-tuning, embeddings, and retrieval techniques to improve performance
Stay up-to-date with AI advancements and bring fresh ideas to the team


If you‚Äôre a language lover, systems thinker, and AI enthusiast ready to turn creativity into capability, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change

At our Data & Analytics department, we specialize in data visualizations, BI tools, analytical consulting, statistics, forecasting, and modern data platforms. Working closely with various departments across Abacus, we combine our analytical expertise with a deep understanding of pharmaceutical markets‚Äîfrom product development to delivery.

We believe that robust Data Science and AI can give Abacus Medicine a competitive edge, uncovering trends and behaviors that drive smarter decision-making. Our advanced machine learning techniques transform complex market data into actionable forecasts. Join us on our growth journey and help shape the future of the pharmaceutical industry.

Get a glimpse of our world

The Data Science team consists of five highly skilled professionals, all dedicated to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine by delivering critical data and insights that drive informed decision-making.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams‚Äîincluding data analysts, data engineers, product managers, and key business stakeholders‚Äîto develop data-driven solutions that scale.

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that power business insights and operational efficiencies and support tactical and strategic decision-making across Abacus Medicine.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Design, develop, and deploy advanced models, including machine learning, deep learning, and algorithmic solutions, to solve complex business problems.
Analyze datasets to generate actionable insights, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Promote best practices in Data Science by optimizing workflows and expanding the DS/ML toolbox with tools that enhance model accuracy, runtime, and maintainability.
Strengthen our technical infrastructure by integrating modern technologies that enhance efficiency, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
Drive innovation by evaluating and integrating emerging ML/AI methodologies, including LLMs, to enhance model performance.
Translate complex model results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Share expertise through knowledge sharing and sparring sessions.
Proactively identify potential data science applications for value creation.
Contribute to branch development initiatives and long-term planning, including roadmap definition.


Fuel for your success in the role

We Imagine You Have


Master‚Äôs degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, cognitive science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
Advanced Python programming skills.
Proficient in Data Science skills ‚Äì ML frameworks (scikit-learn, deep learning frameworks), data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.
Experienced with the following technologies: SQL, Web APIs, Git, Linux commands.
Excellent English communication skills with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Show genuine care for both team dynamics and the success of the organization, fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior working experience in applying data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
Familiarity with the following technologies: MLOps, Spark, Cloud platform (e.g. Azure/AWS), mlflow, ETL processes, CI/CD processes.
Databricks environment for building and deploying ML models.
Leveraging LLMs for enhancing the performance of ML models through prompt engineering and embeddings.


Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV.

To help us better understand your motivation and qualifications for this role, we kindly encourage you to attach both your cover letter and academic transcript. This will give us a clearer overview of your interests and the courses you have completed during your studies.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager,

Mihai Popovici, Advanced Analytics, Data Science & Tech Lead at mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com

Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you‚Äôll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You‚Äôll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Please note that the position will remain open until we find the right candidate, after which the job advertisement will be removed. We encourage interested applicants to submit their applications as early as possible.

Please note that due to the upcoming summer holiday period, the recruitment process may take slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph s√∏ger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at oms√¶tte data til indsigter

Er du vild med √∏konomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Hvem er vi?

I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores r√•dgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse ‚Äì herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder t√¶t sammen i et fagligt st√¶rkt og anerkendt team, hvor n√∏gleordene er innovation, selvst√¶ndighed og faglig stolthed. L√¶s mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datas√¶t, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi oms√¶tte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datam√¶ngderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal v√¶re med til at l√∏se denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du p√• professionel vis h√•ndtere kundens data, levere r√•dgivning og pr√¶sentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret p√• et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhj√¶lper vil hovedsageligt v√¶re at opdatere, automatisere og klarg√∏re data til analyser, samt ops√¶tte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt √•rgangens skarpeste inden for √∏konomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller √∏konometri. Efter et introduktionsforl√∏b, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvst√¶ndigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af pr√¶sentationer ‚Äì i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du f√• muligheden for at bist√• i r√•dgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine f√¶rdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for √∏konomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (s√¶rligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-l√∏sninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvst√¶ndigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forst√•else for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardl√∏sninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob p√• ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel tr√¶ning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planl√¶gger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har h√∏jt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvst√¶ndigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have f√¶rdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger p√• Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kl√∏vermarken p√• Amager, i g√•afstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi ogs√• tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i l√∏bet af √•ret, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ans√∏gning

Hvis ovenst√•ende passer p√• dig, s√• send din ans√∏gning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket p√• denne side. Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers p√• johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Backend Engineer - Python - Copenhagen




We‚Äôre delighted to be working with one of Europe‚Äôs most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




They‚Äôre looking to onboard an experienced backend engineer, to join one of their internal teams.




The Role




In this role, you'll be working as part of the Business Ops team - which focuses on internal processes, developer tools & creating the best possible work environment for both technical & non-technical team members.




You'll work closely with a team of engineers as well as non-technical stakeholders, before crafting innovative solutions to every day problems.




You'll be using Python, with Django being used as their main framework. Whilst this specific role is purely backend focused, they do have space for a Full Stack Engineer in the near future - so don't hesitate to reach out if you have solid TypeScript experience too.




What You‚Äôll Bring




5+ years of commercial software engineering experience
3+ years of experience working with Python
Demonstratable experience of working with internal teams with non-technical staff
Any experience in TypeScript is a plus, but certainly not required




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship‚Äôs still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week‚Äîhelping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The company‚Äôs mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I‚Äôve ever visited, so I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.




Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.
