Title: Data Scientist med AI/ML-fokus til EWIIs Digitale Kundeplatforme
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hvem er vi?

Vi er en energikoncern der leverer vand og fjernvarme i trekantomr√•det samt el, bredb√•nd og ladel√∏sninger til kunder i hele Danmark. Vi har inden for de seneste √•r udskiftet alle vores digitale kundevendte platforme, og har nu en st√¶rk digital tilstedev√¶relse med vores hjemmeside, flere selvbetjeningsl√∏sninger, mobilapps og en marketing automation platform. Platformene er integrerede med hinanden og bygget p√• en moderne og prisbel√∏nnet integrationsplatform, hvor data er gjort tilg√¶ngelige via microservices.

I Digitale Kundeplatforme drifter og videreudvikler vi platformene i t√¶t samarbejde med andre forretningsomr√•der og vores eget tilknyttede IT-udviklingsteam. Vi er allerede i gang med at implementere databaserede l√∏sninger, som en del af vores digitale kundeoplevelser, og √∏nsker nu at tage n√¶ste skridt og s√¶tte fart p√• udviklingen.

Om rollen

Du bliver teamets specialist i machine learning og AI og f√•r ansvar for at udvikle, teste og implementere modeller, der udg√∏r det datam√¶ssige fundament for nye digitale l√∏sninger og services til vores kunder.

Du kommer til at arbejde hands-on med modellering, databehandling og kode ‚Äì i t√¶t samspil med relevante afdelinger s√•som IT-infrastruktur, Data Warehouse og Data Governance. Derudover vil du arbejde sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet, der arbejder med app, web, selvbetjening og marketing automation, om at integrere modellerne direkte i vores digitale platforme og l√∏sninger, s√• de skaber reel v√¶rdi for vores kunder.

Hos EWII arbejder andre data scientists med forskellige form√•l p√• tv√¶rs af organisationen, og vi har allerede et st√¶rkt teknologi- og datasetup p√• plads. I denne rolle f√•r du ansvar for at udvikle modeller baseret p√• kundernes forbrugs- og adf√¶rdsdata ‚Äì kombineret med relevante tredjepartsdata s√•som vejr- og boligdata.

Eksempler p√• arbejdsopgaver



Udvikling og optimering af pr√¶diktive og pr√¶skriptive modeller, som danner udgangspunkt for vores automatiserede kommunikation
Udvikling og optimering af forbrugsalarmer baseret p√• machine learning og anomalidetektion, som automatisk kan opdage, hvis den enkelte kundes forbrug afviger fra deres normalforbrug
Udvikling af personaliserede forbrugsrapporter baseret p√• dataanalyse og integreret med generativt AI, som genererer individuelle rapporter med grafer og forklarende tekst.
Udforske nye teknologier og eksperimentere med ML- og AI-baserede l√∏sninger p√• tv√¶rs af platformene.



Det tilbyder vi‚ÄØ

Som medarbejder i EWII er det ikke kun dit arbejde, der er i centrum - du f√•r ogs√• mange personalegoder, der er v√¶rd at arbejde for. Hvilke goder, du kan nyde godt af, kan du blive klogere p√• her.‚ÄØ

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende ‚Äì fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et √∏nske om at arbejde t√¶ttere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi l√¶gger v√¶gt p√•, at du:



Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede milj√∏er, herunder udvikling af pr√¶diktive og preskriptive modeller p√• Azure Databricks-platformen.
Har st√¶rke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
Forst√•r, hvordan modeller oms√¶ttes til v√¶rdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvst√¶ndigt ansvar for dit ansvarsomr√•de, men s√¶tter pris p√• at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores f√¶lles vision og m√•l.



I rollen f√•r du



En central rolle i et ambiti√∏st digitalt team med st√¶rkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne id√©er til ML- og AI-baserede kundel√∏sninger
Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus p√• digital innovation.



S√¶t et gr√∏nt fodspor sammen med os‚ÄØ

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men f√¶lles for alle er, at fagligheden n√•r helt ud i fingerspidserne ‚Äì og den skal male fremtiden gr√∏n.‚ÄØ

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag ‚Äì uanset om vi l√¶gger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over p√• fiber. Sammen g√∏r vi det, der er sort til gr√∏n business ‚Äì til gavn for milj√∏, kunder og bundlinje.‚ÄØ

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi gl√¶der os til at h√∏re fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ans√∏gning ved at klikke p√• ans√∏gningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ans√∏gninger velkomne uanset k√∏n, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, s√• kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, p√• tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan l√¶se mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads p√• ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du ogs√• f√∏lge med ovre p√• LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram.‚ÄØ

Stillingen bes√¶ttes hurtigst muligt, og du kan s√∏ge den, s√• l√¶nge den er online p√• ewii.dk.‚ÄØVi forventer at afholde de f√∏rste samtaler i uge 32 og 33.

Vi forestiller os, at du har en uddannelse inden for datalogi, machine learning, statistik eller lignende ‚Äì fx cand.scient., cand.polyt. eller cand.it med specialisering i data science. Du har allerede nogen erfaring, og har et √∏nske om at arbejde t√¶ttere sammen med forretningen om dine modeller.

Vi l√¶gger v√¶gt p√•, at du:


  • Har praktisk erfaring med dataanalyse, statistisk modellering og machine learning i cloud-baserede milj√∏er, herunder udvikling af pr√¶diktive og preskriptive modeller p√• Azure Databricks-platformen.
  • Har st√¶rke kompetencer inden for Python og SQL.
  • Forst√•r, hvordan modeller oms√¶ttes til v√¶rdi i en digital forretningskontekst og gerne i forbindelse med digitale kundevendte platforme.
  • Trives i krydsfeltet mellem teknik og forretning og kan forklare komplekse modeller og resultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer
  • Er nysgerrig, forretningsorienteret og trives med et stort selvst√¶ndigt ansvar for dit ansvarsomr√•de, men s√¶tter pris p√• at arbejde teamorienteret mod vores f√¶lles vision og m√•l.


I rollen f√•r du


  • En central rolle i et ambiti√∏st digitalt team med st√¶rkt mandat og stor indflydelse.
  • Frihed til at eksperimentere og udvikle dine egne id√©er til ML- og AI-baserede kundel√∏sninger
  • Samarbejde med kollegaer, der arbejder med digital performance, UX, app- og webudvikling, marketing automation og dataplatforme
  • Adgang til en moderne teknologistak samtidig med, at du bliver en del af en virksomhed med strategisk fokus p√• digital innovation.


S√¶t et gr√∏nt fodspor sammen med os‚ÄØ

I EWII er hverdagen vidt forskellig for vores 700 medarbejdere. Men f√¶lles for alle er, at fagligheden n√•r helt ud i fingerspidserne ‚Äì og den skal male fremtiden gr√∏n.‚ÄØ

I EWIIs kommercielle afdelinger kridter vi kondiskoene hver dag ‚Äì uanset om vi l√¶gger arm med energimarkedet, digitaliserer forretningen eller flytter danskerne over p√• fiber. Sammen g√∏r vi det, der er sort til gr√∏n business ‚Äì til gavn for milj√∏, kunder og bundlinje.‚ÄØ

Er du vores nye kollega?

Vi gl√¶der os til at h√∏re fra dig. Du sender sit CV og motiverede ans√∏gning ved at klikke p√• ans√∏gningsknappen. Hos os er diversitet og forskellighed en styrke, og derfor er alle ans√∏gninger velkomne uanset k√∏n, alder, etnicitet, civilstand etc.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til jobbet eller EWII som arbejdsplads, s√• kontakt endelig afdelingsleder, Jakob Linde, p√• tlf. 28 25 26 85. Du kan l√¶se mere om os som virksomhed og arbejdsplads p√• ewii.dk. Er du mere nysgerrig, kan du ogs√• f√∏lge med ovre p√• LinkedIn, Facebook og Instagram.‚ÄØ

Stillingen bes√¶ttes hurtigst muligt, og du kan s√∏ge den, s√• l√¶nge den er online p√• ewii.dk.‚ÄØVi forventer at afholde de f√∏rste samtaler i uge 32 og 33.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Gr√ºn, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Research Scientist
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist ‚Äì Bioanalytical Team

Location: H√∏rsholm, Denmark

We are seeking an experienced Research Scientist to join the Bioanalytical Team at FMC‚Äôs European Innovation Centre in H√∏rsholm.

You will be a key member in our natural product development projects working closely together with microbiology, fermentation, formulation and field experts. You will perform chemical analysis on conventional products as well as produce, isolate, purify and characterise new and known natural products for testing as agrochemicals using advanced instruments such as HPLC, LC-QTOF, LC-MS/MS and prep flash chromatography system.

Key Responsibilities


Preparation of selected natural products. This includes arranging source material, crude material extraction and isolating, purifying and characterising the desired compounds.
Chemical analysis of known targets in samples deriving from R&D teams
Manage collaborations with internal/external partners for additional sample preparation and chemical characterisation
Support members of the team with instrument troubleshooting and development of analytical methods
Routine maintenance and qualification of laboratory instruments
General housekeeping, and contributing to safety activities


About You

You are a proactive and collaborative scientist who thrives in a dynamic environment and in a job that requires hands on lab work. You have strong communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with people around you.

You Bring


PhD and 3+ years of experience working with natural product chemistry
Experience in analysis of complex mixtures and isolation and purification of milligram amounts using LC-QTOF, Prep HPLC and flash chromatography
Familiar with techniques used for structure elucidation
Knowledge of natural product literature and technologies
Excellent communication and collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment
Confidence working in English, our primary business language


Why FMC?

At FMC, you'll join a supportive, purpose-driven team committed to innovation in sustainable agriculture. We invest in our people and encourage continuous learning and career development.

FMC Corporation is a global agricultural sciences company developing advanced solutions that combine synthetic and biological crop protection, plant health, and precision agriculture technologies.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and will close the vacancy once the right candidate is found.

Interested? We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH ‚Äì Jagtvej 160, 2100 K√∏benhavn √ò

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 K√∏benhavn √ò

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Potteg√•rd (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe‚Äôs top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation ‚Äì with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture ‚Äì creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

HTML:
• Job portal
  • All vacancies

Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:

  • MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
  • Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
  • Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
  • Excellent data handling and analysis skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
  • Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
  • Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
  • Experience with AI/machine learning

Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:

  • Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
  • High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
  • Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
  • Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
  • Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
  • Experience with GDPR compliance
  • Experience with database design and management
  • Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
  • Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
  • Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)

Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH ‚Äì Jagtvej 160, 2100 K√∏benhavn √ò

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 K√∏benhavn √ò

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:

  • Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
  • Curriculum vitae
  • Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
  • List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
  • Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience

Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Potteg√•rd (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation ‚Äì with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture ‚Äì creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
üöÄ We're Hiring: MLOps Engineer | Copenhagen | Hybrid Work

Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)




Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable platforms for machine learning? We‚Äôre looking for an experienced IT Platform Engineer to help shape and support a cutting-edge MLOps environment that powers real-time model deployment and scoring across critical domains, including fraud detection and online payments.




üåç The Role

Join a collaborative squad focused on delivering a future-proof MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You'll take ownership of automating model life cycles‚Äîfrom development to deployment‚Äîand build CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and robust ML pipelines that scale with enterprise needs.




üîß Tech You‚Äôll Use

Cloud: AWS (extensive use), Databricks
Languages: Python, PySpark
Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!




üéØ What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
Collaborate in an agile setup




üë§ About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You‚Äôre a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.




üíº What‚Äôs In It for You

A human-centred, inclusive work culture
Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
Flexible hybrid working setup
Access to development programs and professional certifications
Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
A competitive compensation package and extra leave options

Title: AI/ML Intern (Full-time, Fall 2025)
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of artificial intelligence? Do you want to work on real-world product innovations? Join our AI team at Bang & Olufsen, where we translate state-of-the-art machine learning into products that define the future of sound and interaction.

What You Bring

A real passion and interest for Artificial Intelligence. In order to set you up for success as an intern, we also look for the following skills and experience:



Currently enrolled in a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras.
Demonstrated interest or experience in developing and optimizing algorithms for real-world problems.
Solid understanding of the data lifecycle‚Äîfrom collection to cleaning and model validation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.



What We Offer

Working with the latest machine learning, artificial intelligence, and signal and information processing technology, you will be involved in the design and development pipeline of innovative artificial intelligence solutions.

You will become part of the Artificial Intelligence Group at Bang & Olufsen in Lyngby, dedicated to pioneering advanced AI research for developing systems ready for market integration that facilitate Bang & Olufsen's hallmark user experiences. We cover almost all fields of machine learning. You will be integrated into a multidisciplinary team composed of both machine learning researchers and engineers. Given AI's broad impact, our efforts intersect various technical domains with a special focus on audio and acoustics, fundamental to our brand. The position also offers the chance to engage with and work alongside a diverse group of specialists within various departments at Bang & Olufsen.

From the very first day of your internship, your mentor will closely guide you throughout your time with us. You will work alongside our engineers as an equal member of our team and therefore have a great impact on different parts of our creative processes.

With approximately 1100 employees, Bang & Olufsen is an agile company that gives room for individual flexibility and decision-making. Our hierarchy is flat, and our communication is open and trustworthy. We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package

Location: Kongens Lyngby, Denmark or Struer, Denmark

Start date: Ideally September 1st, 2025 but we're flexible for a prompt start thereafter

Duration: Approximately 6‚Äì8 months,full-time

Travel: Approx. 5%

How To Apply

Submit your CV (in English) and grade transcripts by pressing the ‚ÄòApply‚Äô button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than August 10th 2025. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible; this advert could be close before the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here.

Bang & Olufsen has, for 100 years, developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.

Title: Lead AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

team.blue is the market leader in enabling digital success for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across Europe, catering to over 3 million customers in 25+ languages. Our mission is to make online business success simpler, by providing our customers with all the tools and resources they need to excel online and remain ahead of the curve.

Position Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Lead AI/ML Engineer to technically lead our AI/ML engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing AI & ML models and GenAI solutions that power real production use cases. This role will collaborate closely with Product, and Commercial teams, and take full ownership from ideation to deployment. The environment is fast-paced and high-responsibility, with plenty of room to grow alongside a technical, mission-driven team.

Key Responsibilities:

AI & ML Model Development & Implementation


Design, develop and optimize AI models and LLMs, including training and fine-tuning for various applications
Build, train and optimize ML models, including defining preprocessing, feature engineering, validation strategies, and hyperparameter tuning
Develop AI solutions using LLMs, agentic AI frameworks, RAG pipelines, MCP servers and other related technologies



AI & ML Engineering


Build data ingestion and transformation pipelines to support model training and deployment and ensure reproducible, scalable models
Verify data quality, perform data cleaning, and oversee data acquisition processes as needed.
Develop scalable training and inference pipelines for AI-powered applications



Deployment & Integration


Deploy models to production and create APIs to integrate AI models into business operations
Build and drive adoption of emerging LLM/MLOPs technologies, integrating AI Agents, RAGs, and LLMs using MCP workflows to streamline automation, performance tuning, and large-scale data insights



Research & Innovation


Continously research and integrate the latest advancements in AI, ML and LLMs into products
Translate scientific insights into working prototypes that bridge research and production-ready implementation
Collaborate with internal and external research partners, including academic institutions, industry labs, and vendors



Technical Leadership


Provide technical leadership in AI/ML technologies, including GenAI, Machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
Ensure the technical quality of AI/ML solutions, including architecture, design, implementation, and deployment.
Mentor junior team members and drive the technical direction of AI initiatives within the group



Requirements:


6+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, Applied AI or Research engineering, with 2+ years in a lead role
Deep expertise with GenAI technologies and concepts like LLMs, RAG, Vector databases, AI agents, MCP, LoRA, QLoRA
Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, sklearn), with a proven track record of building and deploying ML models
Practical experience deploying and scaling AI & ML models and agentic AI applications in a production environment, including with LLM inference and serving (vLLm, LiteLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
Knowledge of LLM/MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Awareness of LLM-specific risk domains, including hallucinations, fairness, and data privacy
Strong problem-solving skills with excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams



Nice to have Skills:


Experience building multi-hop RAG systems with self-consistency and chain-of-thought prompting



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

ESG

‚ÄúAt team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.‚Äù

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 3,000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: Co-founders search ‚Äì Machine Learning (ML, AI) / Building Expert (Building Engineer/Architect)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Based in Denmark | Remote | Part-time (Equity only for now)




We are H√òUSE NEXT, a startup on a mission to make housing radically more affordable across Europe.

We are looking for people who describe themselves as bright, energetic, determined, and motivated by solving hard problems that can lead to a huge positive impact on the future. You are not just looking for a job ‚Äî you are looking for a chance to build something that matters.




What We Are Building

We are currently focused on developing PERMIT NEXT, a digital service that automatically generates building permits based on customer-provided data.




We are starting with single-family dwellings and annexes.




The goal is to automate and simplify a process that is traditionally slow and complex.




Open Co-founder Roles

1. Co-founder A ‚Äì Machine Learning Developer

You will lead development of the machine learning model for PERMIT NEXT.

Experience with:

Machine Learning (AI) with use of PDF based input data
JavaScript




2. Co-founder B ‚Äì Building Expert

You will help shape the permitting service, especially focus on requirements of service as well as evaluation of generated permits, also work on hardware prototype (Model A).

Experience with:

Architecture / Civil or Structural Engineering
Building Codes and Regulatory Compliance




What You Should Know

Strong preference for candidates who speak a Scandinavian language
The role is currently unpaid (equity only)
Expected commitment: ~20 hours per week (flexible, remote)... The goal is to transition into a full-time paid position once funding is secured




If you are ready to take on an ambitious challenge and build something from the ground up, we would love to hear from you. It will be tough but the reward can be high.




Please reach out via direct message or email us at ak@h√∏usenext.com ..

Title: Senior Data Scientist in GenAI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

At Danske Bank, combatting financial crime is more than a mission; it is our steadfast commitment to protecting our customers and communities from criminal activities. We aim to build a financial ecosystem of integrity and confidence, enabling communities to thrive and grow.

Are you ready to transform the financial crime prevention landscape? Join us at the forefront of technological innovation, utilizing generative AI to transform financial crime prevention processes within Danske Bank.

The Role

In this role, you will explore and evaluate pre-trained large language models (LLMs) to identify the best use cases and ensure their effective application. You will also develop innovative prompting techniques and strategies to reduce hallucinations and improve the quality of generated outputs.

Additionally, you will:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement current solutions that reshape the financial crime risk management landscape.
Stay informed about the latest advancements in generative AI, bringing valuable insights and ideas to the team.


Your Profile

To thrive in this role, you should have a strong technical foundation and a keen interest in innovation in AI. You bring expertise in Python and commonly used AI/ML libraries and frameworks, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Hugging Face. Your knowledge of machine learning and deep learning techniques is complemented by a focus on natural language processing (NLP).

Other key qualifications include:


Practical experience with prompting techniques (e.g., few-shot prompting, chain-of-thought prompting) and fine-tuning LLMs.
Extensive experience in designing and building scalable data pipelines for generative AI solutions (e.g., SQL, APIs, vector databases, relational databases).
Familiarity or direct experience with cloud data infrastructure, such as AWS, and optimising storage and query performance.
Prior expertise in generative AI, with practical experience implementing advanced solutions in this field.


Have we caught your attention?

If you believe this opportunity aligns with your aspirations, we would like to hear from you. For any questions, please contact Julius Vazgela, Chapter Lead, at https://www.linkedin.com/in/vazgela/

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

At Danske Bank, combatting financial crime is more than a mission; it is our steadfast commitment to protecting our customers and communities from criminal activities. We aim to build a financial ecosystem of integrity and confidence, enabling communities to thrive and grow.

Are you ready to transform the financial crime prevention landscape? Join us at the forefront of technological innovation, utilizing generative AI to transform financial crime prevention processes within Danske Bank.

The Role

In this role, you will explore and evaluate pre-trained large language models (LLMs) to identify the best use cases and ensure their effective application. You will also develop innovative prompting techniques and strategies to reduce hallucinations and improve the quality of generated outputs.

Additionally, you will:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement current solutions that reshape the financial crime risk management landscape.
  • Stay informed about the latest advancements in generative AI, bringing valuable insights and ideas to the team.

Your Profile

To thrive in this role, you should have a strong technical foundation and a keen interest in innovation in AI. You bring expertise in Python and commonly used AI/ML libraries and frameworks, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Hugging Face. Your knowledge of machine learning and deep learning techniques is complemented by a focus on natural language processing (NLP).

Other key qualifications include:

  • Practical experience with prompting techniques (e.g., few-shot prompting, chain-of-thought prompting) and fine-tuning LLMs.
  • Extensive experience in designing and building scalable data pipelines for generative AI solutions (e.g., SQL, APIs, vector databases, relational databases).
  • Familiarity or direct experience with cloud data infrastructure, such as AWS, and optimising storage and query performance.
  • Prior expertise in generative AI, with practical experience implementing advanced solutions in this field.

Have we caught your attention?

If you believe this opportunity aligns with your aspirations, we would like to hear from you. For any questions, please contact Julius Vazgela, Chapter Lead, at https://www.linkedin.com/in/vazgela/

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You‚Äôll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Cloud & AI Solution Engineer ‚Äì AI Applications
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you insatiably curious, deeply passionate about the realm of AI & applications, and ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment? If so, we invite you to join our team as a Cloud & AI Solution Engineer in AI Applications for‚ÄØcommercial customers‚ÄØat Microsoft. Here, you'll be at the forefront of cutting-edge projects that leverage the latest technologies to drive meaningful impact. Join us and be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.

Microsoft is transforming the developer experience for AI applications across the development lifecycle. With AI Foundry and seamless integration with Azure AI, we‚Äôre leading the way in Agentic AI development where AI agents streamline development and operations. As an AI Apps Solution Engineer, you‚Äôll help customers boost productivity and become AI-native.

As an AI Applications Solution Engineer (SE), you will play a pivotal role in helping enterprise AI developers unlock the full potential of Microsoft‚Äôs AI-powered stack across every stage of the development lifecycle. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate AI Foundry, Azure AI, and Responsible AI, through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, hone your technical skills, and become adept at solution design and deployment. You‚Äôll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications development into their deployment workflows. In summary, you‚Äôll help customers modernize their applications and realize the full value of Microsoft‚Äôs AI platform, all while enjoying flexible work opportunities.

As a trusted technical advisor, you‚Äôll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications and agents into their development workflows. In summary, you‚Äôll help customers modernize their applications leveraging AI and realize the full value of Microsoft‚Äôs platform.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Drive technical sales with decision makers using demos and PoCs to influence solution design and enable production deployments.
Lead hands-on engagements‚Äîhackathons, code-with sessions, and architecture workshops‚Äîto accelerate adoption of Microsoft‚Äôs developer tools and cloud platforms.
Build trusted relationships with developers and platform leads, co-designing secure, scalable architectures and solutions
Resolve technical blockers and objections, collaborating with engineering to share insights and improve products.
Maintain deep expertise in AI Foundry & App architecture (Agentic AI framework, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI) and App architecture/cloud native dev (APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java or .NET).
Maintain and grow expertise in AI Management & Security (Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, orchestrator, monitoring).
Represent Microsoft through thought leadership in developer communities and customer forums


Qualifications

Required Qualifications (RQs)


Proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience‚ÄØOR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience‚ÄØ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A couple year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience‚ÄØ OR equivalent experience
Expert on full stack App architecture design / modernization and cloud native dev (e.g., APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java, .NET)
Expert for AI & ML models (e.g., Agentic AI framework, AI Foundry, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI, fine-tuning/inferencing, etc.)
Proven ability to lead technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
Proven years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructure, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management
Proficient on Agentic framework, AI Management & Security (e.g., Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, Responsible AI, orchestrator, monitoring)
Skilled with 1 or more frameworks, tools, languages (e.g., GitHub, Copilot Studio, VS Code, Jupyter, PyCharm, Node.js, Python, Java, C#, C++, AI Assisted Dev Tools)
Proficiency in Danish is preferred.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: AI Solutions Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go we aim to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. 40% of all the food produced in the world is wasted, with a big impact on the planet: 10% of greenhouse gas emissions worldwide come from food loss and waste.

Too Good To Go operates the world‚Äôs largest B2C marketplace for surplus food. Through our app we connect businesses that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who can buy and enjoy it at a reduced price. We are a mission-driven certified B Corp.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of over 124 million registered users across 19 countries has already saved more than 473+ million meals from going to waste - together avoiding more than 1.278.000 tonnes of CO2e from entering the atmosphere.

In 2023, Apple recognised Too Good To Go as Winner at the annual App Store Awards, for our app‚Äôs exceptional user experience and profound impact on society.

We always look for talented people with diverse backgrounds to join our team. Right now, we‚Äôre recruiting our very first AI Solutions Developer!

Your mission

As our AI Solutions Developer you will design and implement artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions that automate and optimize our commercial business processes, with the aim of driving Sales efficiency. You will partner with stakeholders across commercial, product and engineering teams to identify opportunities for process optimization by leveraging AI, and lead the design, testing and scaling of solutions, while ensuring alignment with technical standards, security, and compliance requirements.

You will tackle specific business challenges in our sales operations on a project basis, and leverage your deep knowledge of AI tools in the market to develop MVP solutions, and embed these into the daily sales processes.

By combining your technical skills and commercial understanding, you will help our sales teams across 19 countries work more effectively, spend time on what matters, ultimately leading to more food saved. This role will be based in Copenhagen and reports to our Chief Commercial Officer.

Role Description


Opportunity Identification: You will be gathering context of existing sales processes to assess key opportunities for automation and AI/ML solutions in our operations, challenging current setups, and being a sparring partner to the rest of the Global Commercial teams and broader organization.
Solution Design & Architecture: You will lead the end-to-end selection and design of AI/ML systems for commercial teams, from requesting data pipelines, selecting the appropriate models to use, sourcing/developing tools and prompts, and deploying and monitoring solutions.
Change Management: Your job is to drive change in the organization, and you will be working with other teams in the Global Commercial function to introduce new AI tools and improve ways of working in our operations for lasting impact.
Stakeholder Collaboration: The work is cross-functional by nature, and you will be engaging with colleagues across the company to map workflows and identify automation opportunities. You will be responsible for translating business needs into powerful technical solutions.
Platform & Tooling Selection: As an internal AI expert, you will be recommending which AI platforms and tools we should leverage in our commercial teams. You will oversee procurement and integration of third-party AI services in the Sales community, in close collaboration with our Tech and Legal teams.
Security & Compliance: You will be expected to comply with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and organizational security policies.
Community & Knowledge Sharing. As a domain expert, you will form a community with other data scientists, ML engineers, and developers in the company on AI practices, and be an ambassador of the AI journey across all teams.


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Solid experience with business process automation platforms and iPaaS solutions.
Strong understanding of APIs and webhook integrations.
Experience with JSON, data mapping, and transformation.
Proficiency in workflow logic, conditional operations, and error handling.
Experience designing and implementing automated workflow solutions using modern workflow automation platforms (such as Make.com, N8N, Zapier, or similar tools)
Strong AI prompting skills, experience leveraging APIs to connect data sources, and building MVP solutions.
Experience with project and change management, preferably from introduction of new tech solutions.
Good understanding of sales processes, preferably in a B2B environment.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a global social impact company and certified B Corporation, where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Work alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries on the same important sustainability mission.
Personal and professional development in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work.
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate success and socialise with colleagues that care.


Benefits


Work Flexibly
Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home or abroad.
Extra parental leave and days off beyond local legislation and the option to take an extra week of unpaid leave
Health insurance and pension plans (subject to country of employment).
Additional days off for significant life events
Celebrate and Socialise
Regular social events like summer and winter parties.
Coffee, snacks and fully-equipped kitchens.
Get to know our community with a monthly free Surprise Bag.
Paid volunteer time through our Shareback volunteering programme
Women in the Workplace, P.R.I.D.E., People of Colour and Functionally Diverse Employee Resource Groups

How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

  • An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work.

Benefits

  • Work Flexibly
    • Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home or abroad.
    • Extra parental leave and days off beyond local legislation and the option to take an extra week of unpaid leave
    • Health insurance and pension plans (subject to country of employment).
    • Additional days off for significant life events
  • Celebrate and Socialise
    • Regular social events like summer and winter parties.
    • Coffee, snacks and fully-equipped kitchens.
    • Get to know our community with a monthly free Surprise Bag.
    • Paid volunteer time through our Shareback volunteering programme
    • Women in the Workplace, P.R.I.D.E., People of Colour and Functionally Diverse Employee Resource Groups
How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
We're looking for an AI Software Engineer to help shape the direction of our new AI initiative and build intelligent systems powered by LLMs and AI agents right at the heart of our tech platform.




About CEGO

CEGO is an ambitious software company located by the waterfront in Aalborg. We offer an informal work culture with flexibility, freedom, and a high degree of trust. We operate Spilnu.dk, one of Denmark's largest online casinos, and have expanded our success to the UK with Happy Tiger. We develop everything in-house using open-source technologies from games and platforms to our upcoming AI projects.




About the role

We‚Äôre hiring for a newly established position as AI Software Engineer to join us on-site at our office in Aalborg, where you‚Äôll be responsible for developing next-generation AI solutions based on Large Language Models (LLMs), AI agents, and modern AI architectures.




This is a pioneering role where you'll be our first in-house specialist in this field. You'll bring a new technological toolbox to CEGO and play a key role in defining how we work with AI going forward. You'll collaborate closely with our talented developers in the Platform department, who will provide strong technical sparring - but you should thrive in leading the way into new territory.

You‚Äôll be part of our Platform department consisting of 38 colleagues, including DevOps, software developers, UX designers, and frontend developers.




Your main tasks include:

Develop and implement AI solutions using LLMs, AI agents, and machine learning techniques such as fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG (Retriever-Augmented Generation), ReACT, and meta-prompting
Design and optimize agent-based systems using technologies like LangChain, LangGraph, LangSmith, or similar
Build APIs and integrations to connect AI solutions with our existing systems
Contribute to innovation and prototyping across teams and business areas
Stay up to date on AI trends and evaluate how they can be applied to create business value




About you

We imagine you're a proactive team player with a developer mindset and a commercial edge. We‚Äôre looking for someone who:




Has a solid understanding of machine learning and can distinguish between classical ML and modern LLM applications
Is familiar with techniques like prompt chaining and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Understands agent-based AI systems and workflow orchestration
Has experience with API development and system integration
Is comfortable evaluating and optimizing AI model performance
Is curious and eager to explore new technologies




We offer:

A chance to join one of Aalborg‚Äôs most ambitious and attractive workplaces
Full ownership of our own products and roadmaps - no clients or external deadlines
No time tracking
An agile, flat organization with fast decision-making
Flexible working hours, 30 minutes of paid daily break, and a no-overtime policy
Perks like daily breakfast, in-house gym, personal training twice a week, and massage
A strong focus on well-being, professionalism, and collaboration
Health insurance and pension plan




We know that engaged and skilled employees create the best results. That‚Äôs why we work actively to ensure an environment where you can thrive and be challenged at the same time.




How to apply

Submit your CV and a motivated application via our website as soon as possible. We review applications on an ongoing basis. Start date is as soon as possible.




We encourage all qualified candidates to apply - regardless of gender, age, religion, or ethnic background.




About CEGO A/S

Founded in 2000, CEGO A/S operates a number of subsidiaries running online casinos in both Denmark and internationally. In 2012, we launched Spilnu.dk and were among the first companies to receive a casino license when Denmark liberalized its gambling laws.




Spilnu.dk features unique, in-house developed slot machines inspired by the classic "one-armed bandit" with a twist of engaging bonus games for extra fun. The platform encourages a social, cozy gaming experience, allowing players to chat while playing.




Outside Denmark, we operate in the UK under the brand Happy Tiger. CEGO A/S is owned by three Aalborg-based entrepreneurs and the private equity firm VIA equity.




You‚Äôll find us in our inspiring office at the waterfront in Aalborg, where about 130 employees work across game development, web development, game and sound design, graphics, customer support, server administration, and platform operations. We also have departments supporting Compliance & Legal, Marketing, Finance, and HR.

Title: AI Specialist / Prompt Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Work Eligibility: EU/EEA citizenship or valid work permit

Job Type: Full-time

Lead the Agentic AI Revoltion

Be on the frontline of the AgentForce movement. As a Prompt Engineer or AI Specialist at Y4, you‚Äôll embed generative AI into real-world solutions, from advisory tooling to workflow automation and beyond.

Key Responsibilities


Design and refine AI prompts and agents across Salesforce use-cases
Partner with domain experts to co-create tools for consultants and clients
Build, test, and optimize LLM-powered experiences
Contribute to Y4‚Äôs internal IP and AI accelerator toolkit


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Experience with LLMs and prompt engineering (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)
Strong understanding of Salesforce or enterprise processes a plus
Creative thinker with a builder‚Äôs mindset
Comfortable working in ambiguity and rapid prototyping environments


What We Offer


A high-performing, passionate Salesforce team always doing what's right for the customer
Laid-back, no-politics culture with flat hierarchies and a strong focus on trust & work-life balance
Career acceleration through trust, leadership tracks and mentorship
Meaningful impact on clients and real ownership of delivery
Competitive compensation ‚Äì We value your experience and expertise


Why Join Y4?

At Y4, we‚Äôre not just building a consultancy. We‚Äôre reinventing what consulting can be. You‚Äôll join a team of senior experts, strategists, and innovators who care deeply about doing the right work, not just ticking boxes. Here, you won‚Äôt be lost in layers of hierarchy or buried in backlogs, you‚Äôll own meaningful work, shape bold solutions, and help redefine the role of AI in business transformation. Whether you‚Äôre a hands-on builder, a sharp thinker, or a future leader, Y4 offers a platform to grow fast, contribute deeply, and be part of a culture that values clarity, trust, and human connection. If you‚Äôre ready to build the future of consulting, one smart, impactful project at a time. We‚Äôd love to meet you.
