Title: Freelance Software Developer (Rust) - AI Trainer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Fullstack AI Engineer ‚Äì WasteHero
Description:
Help us reinvent municipal infrastructure ‚Äì with AI.

At WasteHero, we're on a mission to build the most advanced, intelligent municipal software platform in Europe. Our customers are cities and waste companies ‚Äì the backbone of public life ‚Äì and we help them digitize operations, optimize resources, and become smarter every day. Now, we're ready to go AI-first. And we need a builder.

We're looking for a Fullstack AI Engineer who can combine classic engineering skills with modern AI tooling to ship real, production-grade AI agents, flows, and tools ‚Äì fast. This isn't a research role. This is about building things that work.

What You‚Äôll Do


Build internal AI agents that automate everything from public tender qualification to API-based integration flows.
Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to develop real, end-to-end flows.
Translate domain knowledge (from product, integration, support) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
Develop backend logic and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Supabase.
Collaborate directly with our founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and products.
Optionally: build or connect frontend UIs via Lovable, Retool, or React.


Who You Are


You have 2‚Äì4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
You've already built real things with AI ‚Äì agents, automations, internal tools, or API wrappers. (We‚Äôre not looking for beginners.)
You're comfortable with JavaScript/TypeScript or Python, REST APIs, and database logic.
You‚Äôve used tools like LangChain, GPT, Claude, Supabase, or n8n ‚Äî and ideally connected them together.
You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: experience with public infrastructure, tenders, waste, logistics, or ERP systems.


Why Join Us


Work on real-world AI problems ‚Äî not gimmicks.
Be part of a small, ambitious, and product-driven team with deep market traction.
Ship and own projects that get used by municipalities and companies across Europe.
Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: waste & city infrastructure.
Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.
Located in Aarhus? Great. Prefer hybrid or remote (within CET ¬±2)? Also great.


Tech Stack You‚Äôll Touch


GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
LangChain / n8n / Supabase
Python / Node.js / TypeScript
REST APIs (internal and customer)
Lovable / Retool / React (optional)
Other tech stacks that can improve efficiency


Compensation


Competitive salary based on experience
Equity/warrants
Office in Aarhus C with hybrid flexibility
Real ownership. No bureaucracy.


Ready to build the future of public infrastructure with AI?

Apply here

Let‚Äôs make cities smarter ‚Äî together.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Senior Data Scientist

We are seeking an exceptional Senior Data Scientist to join our highly skilled team in Copenhagen. You will play a pivotal role in developing a state-of-the-art system that leverages Bayesian statistics and advanced theoretical concepts to estimate and understand the size of marketing and advertising audiences. This initiative is a cornerstone of Choreograph‚Äôs broader mission to revolutionise analytics capabilities across the organisation using AI and data science.

You will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where objectives evolve rapidly and complex, abstract problems are the norm. If you are passionate about tackling challenging statistical and mathematical problems, and enjoy working collaboratively with other experts, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement Bayesian statistical models and other advanced analytical methods to estimate audience sizes and characteristics.
Collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary team to design, build, and refine data-driven solutions.
Write high-quality, production-ready Python code including package development, unit testing, and documentation.
Work independently to solve complex mathematical and conceptual problems with minimal supervision.
Engage in productive, abstract discussions with team members to untangle nuanced issues and arrive at robust solutions.
Contribute to code repositories using Git and participate in code reviews and version control best practices.
Utilize cloud computing resources for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Handle diverse data formats and ensure data integrity throughout the analytics pipeline.
Adapt quickly to changing project requirements and priorities.


Must-Have Qualifications & Skills


Postgraduate-level knowledge in probability and statistics, with a strong foundation in Bayesian methods.
Advanced Python programming skills, including experience with building packages, unit testing, and handling multiple data formats.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex mathematical and statistical problems.
Resilience and confidence in facing difficult, open-ended challenges.
Adaptability to dynamic, fast-changing environments, ideally with experience in startup-like or high-pressure settings.
Ability to work independently and creatively, finding solutions to novel problems with minimal supervision.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in discussing and resolving abstract or conceptual issues.
Familiarity with Git and repository management.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).


Nice-to-Have Skills & Experience


Programming experience in Scala and understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
Knowledge of set theory and propositional logic.
Background in media, advertising, or digital advertising analytics.
Familiarity with the unique challenges of audience measurement and marketing analytics.


What We Offer


The opportunity to work on cutting-edge analytics projects with global impact.
A collaborative, intellectually stimulating environment with leading experts.
Flexible, fast-moving work culture similar to a startup, within the stability of a global organization.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Access to world-class resources and professional development opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.
Show more

  • Programming experience in Scala and understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
  • Knowledge of set theory and propositional logic.
  • Background in media, advertising, or digital advertising analytics.
  • Familiarity with the unique challenges of audience measurement and marketing analytics.

What We Offer

  • The opportunity to work on cutting-edge analytics projects with global impact.
  • A collaborative, intellectually stimulating environment with leading experts.
  • Flexible, fast-moving work culture similar to a startup, within the stability of a global organization.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Access to world-class resources and professional development opportunities.

We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Senior ML Engineer - AI Agents

Zendesk‚Äôs people have one goal in mind: to make Customer Experience better. Our products help more than 125,000 global brands (AirBnb, Uber, JetBrains, Slack, among others) make their billions of customers happy, every day.

Our team is dedicated to providing a state-of-the-art retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) platform across multiple channels; including customer service bots, email and search. In collaboration with ML scientists, we deliver high-quality AI products leveraging the latest tools and techniques, and serve them at a scale that most companies can only dream of. We‚Äôre passionate about empowering end-users to quickly find answers to their questions, and helping our customers make the most of their knowledge base.

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior ML engineer to join our team and play a key role in levelling up the RAG platform powering Zendesk!

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Delivering AI-powered capabilities to our customers at Zendesk scale using the latest in LLM technology
Working closely with Product Management, ML Scientists and other ML Engineers to define feature scope and implementation strategies
Mentoring junior team members, as well as pairing with more experienced colleagues to foster mutual learning
Supporting our deployed services to ensure a high level of stability and reliability
Contributing to discussions regarding technical design and best practices
Writing clean and maintainable code to meet the team‚Äôs delivery commitments
Here some of the challenges you will be working on:
How do we best expand our RAG platform to handle new use cases?
How do we optimize our system for both speed and cost-efficiency?
How do we incorporate multiple sources of context to improve the accuracy of our generated answers?
How do we make the best use of rapidly evolving LLM technologies?
And many more!

Basic Qualifications

What you bring to the role


4+ years developing machine learning systems in Python
Solid understanding of architecture and software design patterns for server-side applications
Experience with managing and deploying cloud services with a cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience building scalable and stable software applications
Collaborative and growth mindset, with a commitment to ongoing learning and development
Self-managed and agile, with the ability to problem-solve independently
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with using LLMs at scale
Experience in designing and implementing RAG systems
Experience with managing and deploying cloud services with AWS
Proven experience making data-driven engineering decisions; formulating hypotheses, conducting experiments, and analyzing results.


What Our Tech Stack Looks Like


Our code is largely written in Python, with some parts in Ruby
Our platform is built on AWS
Data is stored in RDS MySQL, Redis, S3, ElasticSearch, Kafka, and Athena
Services are deployed to Kubernetes using Docker, with Kafka for stream processing
Infrastructure health is monitored using Datadog and Sentry


What We Offer


Team of passionate people who love what they do!
Exciting opportunity to work with LLMs and RAG (retrieval augmented generation), rapidly evolving fields in AI
Ownership of the product features at scale, making a significant impact for millions of customers
Opportunity to learn and grow!
Possibility to specialise in areas such as security, performance, and reliability
and everything you need to be effective and maintain work-life balance
Flexible working hours
Professional development funds
Comfortable office and a remote-friendly environment


The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a ‚Äú2 in a box‚Äù model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
Hands-on experience in ‚Äì Databricks asset bundles, Databricks MLFlow, Databricks MLOps stack customization, GitHub Actions for Databricks model deployments, Data bricks Unity Catalog
Experience in Python, Pyspark
Experience in Github tools Terraform and container orchestration, YAML
Understanding of Leveraging docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Upper-Intermediate English skills


‚ÄúWe believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.‚Äù

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Gr√ºn, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

P√• hverdage henter du familiens el-ladcykel i hjemmet og cykler hen for at hente ham fra skole (ca. 2 km hver vej). Resten af tiden bruger I p√• hans yndlingsaktiviteter ‚Äì det kan v√¶re leg derhjemme, ture p√• legepladsen eller fx et bes√∏g i legeland i weekenden.

Drengen trives bedst med tydelige rammer og har brug for st√∏tte til at forst√• sociale signaler. Jeres samv√¶r foreg√•r i et roligt tempo, hvor du s√¶tter rammen og f√∏lger hans initiativer.

V√¶r opm√¶rksom p√•, at der er kat i hjemmet.

Om dig

Du har kendskab til autisme og er god til at skabe struktur. Du har t√•lmodighed, kan bevare roen og arbejder anerkendende med drengen i centrum. Du kan v√¶re p√¶dagog eller ufagl√¶rt med relevant erfaring.

Arbejdstid

Stillingen er p√• ca. 45 timer om m√•neden fordelt s√•dan:

  • Hverdage: Mandag og torsdag kl. 13.15‚Äì16.15 (ca. 25 timer/m√•ned)
  • Weekender: Vagter efter aftale, typisk ca. 20 timer/m√•ned

Vi tilbyder

Du bliver en del af en familieejet virksomhed med en masse engagerede medarbejdere. Du har en fast r√•dgiver, som du altid kan f√• sparring hos. Udenfor kontorets √•bningstid er der altid en bemandet vagttelefon, s√• du er aldrig alene. L√∏n og pension i henhold til Landsoverenskomst for handicaphj√¶lp i borgers eget hjem (minus BPA) indg√•et mellem FOA og Dansk Erhverv. Du er d√¶kket af DUOS‚Äô ansvars- og arbejdsskadeforsikring og sundhedsforsikring er en del af din pensionsordning. Du modtager relevant introduktion og l√∏bende opkvalificering - og s√• kan du slet ikke undg√• at udvikle dig b√•de personligt og fagligt, n√•r du arbejder med mennesker hos os i DUOS.

Vil du v√¶re vores nye kollega?

S√• send en ans√∏gning via linket. Du skal have en profil p√• mit.duos.dk og v√¶re logget ind for at s√∏ge. Vi holder samtaler l√∏bende, send derfor gerne din ans√∏gning med det samme. Tiltr√¶delse snarest muligt. Har du yderligere sp√∏rgsm√•l, er du velkommen til at kontakte rekrutteringskonsulent Thilde Andersen Emig p√• 3634 4990. Du kan altid finde svar p√• generelle sp√∏rgsm√•l her: FAQ

Vi er mennesker, der hj√¶lper mennesker

I DUOS hj√¶lper vi mennesker i hverdagen, st√∏tter dem i sv√¶re situationer og bidrager til deres trivsel og livskvalitet. Som en af Danmarks st√∏rste og √¶ldste velf√¶rdsleverand√∏rer str√¶ber vi efter at v√¶re til stede der, hvor behovet er. Vi kender betydningen af den rette empati og den rette faglige viden, og vi ved, at det er afg√∏rende at sikre det rette match mellem medarbejder og borger, hvis vores ydelser skal have v√¶rdi.

Kom og v√¶r med p√• DUOS-holdet. Og g√∏r en vigtig forskel for et andet menneske.

L√¶s mere om DUOS p√• www.duos.dk

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models to meet project-specific guidelines.
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
Ensuring clarity, consistency, and factual accuracy.
Providing feedback to writers and working with QA Specialists to uphold quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You are currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Cloud sourcing platform is a plus
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Backend Engineer - Python - Copenhagen




We‚Äôre delighted to be working with one of Europe‚Äôs most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




They‚Äôre looking to onboard an experienced backend engineer, to join one of their internal teams.




The Role




In this role, you'll be working as part of the Business Ops team - which focuses on internal processes, developer tools & creating the best possible work environment for both technical & non-technical team members.




You'll work closely with a team of engineers as well as non-technical stakeholders, before crafting innovative solutions to every day problems.




You'll be using Python, with Django being used as their main framework. Whilst this specific role is purely backend focused, they do have space for a Full Stack Engineer in the near future - so don't hesitate to reach out if you have solid TypeScript experience too.




What You‚Äôll Bring




5+ years of commercial software engineering experience
3+ years of experience working with Python
Demonstratable experience of working with internal teams with non-technical staff
Any experience in TypeScript is a plus, but certainly not required




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship‚Äôs still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week‚Äîhelping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The company‚Äôs mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I‚Äôve ever visited, so I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.




Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.

This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
Experience with PyO3/maturin for Python-Rust interoperability
Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD for hybrid Python-Rust apps

Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Title: Research Scientist
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist ‚Äì Bioanalytical Team

Location: H√∏rsholm, Denmark

We are seeking an experienced Research Scientist to join the Bioanalytical Team at FMC‚Äôs European Innovation Centre in H√∏rsholm.

You will be a key member in our natural product development projects working closely together with microbiology, fermentation, formulation and field experts. You will perform chemical analysis on conventional products as well as produce, isolate, purify and characterise new and known natural products for testing as agrochemicals using advanced instruments such as HPLC, LC-QTOF, LC-MS/MS and prep flash chromatography system.

Key Responsibilities


Preparation of selected natural products. This includes arranging source material, crude material extraction and isolating, purifying and characterising the desired compounds.
Chemical analysis of known targets in samples deriving from R&D teams
Manage collaborations with internal/external partners for additional sample preparation and chemical characterisation
Support members of the team with instrument troubleshooting and development of analytical methods
Routine maintenance and qualification of laboratory instruments
General housekeeping, and contributing to safety activities


About You

You are a proactive and collaborative scientist who thrives in a dynamic environment and in a job that requires hands on lab work. You have strong communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with people around you.

You Bring


PhD and 3+ years of experience working with natural product chemistry
Experience in analysis of complex mixtures and isolation and purification of milligram amounts using LC-QTOF, Prep HPLC and flash chromatography
Familiar with techniques used for structure elucidation
Knowledge of natural product literature and technologies
Excellent communication and collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment
Confidence working in English, our primary business language


Why FMC?

At FMC, you'll join a supportive, purpose-driven team committed to innovation in sustainable agriculture. We invest in our people and encourage continuous learning and career development.

FMC Corporation is a global agricultural sciences company developing advanced solutions that combine synthetic and biological crop protection, plant health, and precision agriculture technologies.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and will close the vacancy once the right candidate is found.

Interested? We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Healthcare Assistant - No Experience Needed - Work In Ireland - Paid Relocation
Description:
Mercier Consultancy BG is excited to offer a rewarding opportunity for individuals who aspire to become Healthcare Assistants in Ireland. This position requires no prior experience, making it an excellent choice for those looking to start their career in healthcare. We provide a paid relocation package to assist you in your transition. In this role, you will have the chance to make a real difference in the lives of patients by offering compassionate and dedicated support.

Key Responsibilities:


Assist patients with daily living tasks, including personal hygiene, dressing, and feeding
Provide companionship and emotional support to patients to enhance their quality of life
Maintain a clean and safe environment by following hygiene and safety protocols
Observe and report any changes in patients' health status to the nursing staff
Engage patients in recreational and social activities that promote mental and emotional well-being
Support nursing staff with routine duties to ensure smooth healthcare operations
Participate in training sessions to improve your skills and knowledge in patient care


Requirements


No experience required; a willingness to learn and a caring attitude are essential
Fluency in English is important for effective communication with patients and colleagues
A compassionate approach towards patients is vital
Ability to work effectively both in a team and independently
Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills
Commitment to adhering to healthcare regulations and best practices
Willingness to relocate to Ireland and embrace a new cultural experience


Benefits


Competitive salary (‚Ç¨28,000-‚Ç¨30,000 depending on experience and location)
Paid training and ongoing career development
Full-time guaranteed contracts
Free uniform and parking
Flight fares paid
Cycle to work scheme
Employee assistance and wellbeing program
Supportive, friendly working environments and a warm Irish welcome
Relocation assistance to help candidates settle comfortably in Ireland
Help with identifying job opportunities for accompanying family members

Title: Associate AI Engineer
Place: Humleb√¶k, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Studied Software Development or Data Science ‚Äì do you want to become an Associate AI Engineer?

Would you like to join us as we scale our AI team? You have finished your studies want to start your career by bringing the right AI tools to the business to create value.

Join us as we identify the AI models and solutions, we configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

‚ÄùBringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, you‚Äôll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose,‚Äù says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a relatively new AI team. The team is responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

‚ÄúThis area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. We are working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally ‚Äì and growing our team along the way,‚Äù explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplast‚Äôs strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions, setting up agents, configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails


Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation




Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to test our AI models and make sure we create the best solutions.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you


Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration from your studies or work
Have worked in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments as part of your studies or work
Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages from your studies or work
Have knowledge of access management and infrastructure as code
Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Are fluent in English
Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world¬¥s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward ‚Äì we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because ‚Äì and not despite ‚Äì of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

59299


Show more

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you

  • Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
  • Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration from your studies or work
  • Have worked in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments as part of your studies or work
  • Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages from your studies or work
  • Have knowledge of access management and infrastructure as code
  • Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
  • Are fluent in English
  • Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.



Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world¬¥s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward ‚Äì we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because ‚Äì and not despite ‚Äì of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

59299

Title: Service Engineer
Description:
Our belief:


At SOLPLANET, we are driven by a simple idea: solar for everybody
We strive to create the best possible experience for distributors, installers and end users
That¬¥s why our solar inverters, energy storage systems and EV chargers are easy-to-install, reliable and user friendly


Who We Are:


Private equity-backed AISWEI is a leading provider of renewable energy solutions - providing the world with solar inverters, batteries, EV chargers, heat pumps, and energy management solutions
AISWEI has more than 15 years of expertise in R&D and manufacturing, with a strong technology heritage from both Germany and China
With 32 GW of annual production volumes (2024), AISWEI is one of the largest manufacturers of solar string inverters world-wide
AISWEI is operating under its own brand in China and its SOLPLANET brand internationally, and is trusted by leading global brands as an ODM service provider
Our team passionately believe that that we are all fellow citizens of one planet, and we are truly honored about deploying our solutions to local societies worldwide - every day


How you¬¥ll help us:

As a Service Engineer:


Provide technical troubleshooting support to installers and other customers via phone or digital channels
Provide commissioning support (remote or on-site)
Actively collaborate with international and local colleagues/departments to effectively resolve customer issues
Plan and coordinate the logistics to dispatch inverters for replacement and assist in the collection of inverters
Support the qualification, onboarding and management of new service partners
Accurately document all relevant case information using CRM software
Deliver training sessions to customers or internal colleagues
Continuously identify opportunities to improve products and processes in order to improve customer satisfaction and company cost-effectiveness
Regularly collect feedback such as customer satisfaction to assist in continuous improvement of the after sales process


Requirements

Your background and skills:


Bachelor or above technical degrees, preferably in electrical engineering, renewable energy, photovoltaic engineering, or similar disciplines
Native in Danish and business fluent in English
In-depth knowledge of the technical requirements for PV, energy storage systems, EV chargers in the distribution and/or utility scale segments, including product specifications, grid code requirements, competitive landscape, tender requirements etc
Ability to work independently and focused in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Prior work experience in a PV related industry is not a necessity but will be an advantage


Your attributes:


Self-motivated and performance driven
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Can-do attitude and hands-on mindset
Proactive, dynamic, solution and customer oriented


Benefits

What we offer:


Giving you the unique opportunity to be part of a spirited and diverse team of passionate experts that work together within an exceptionally open-minded environment
Assisting you in to develop, personally and professionally, to grow internally within an international environment which leverages your abilities, skills and expertise
Providing you the unique opportunity to be part of an ambitious, energetic and rapidly growing Solplanet team with flat hierarchies, fast decision making and strong opportunities to successfully cultivate your long-term path within the renewable energy industry


By submitting your application, you declare your agreement to saving your application data at Aiswei B.V, and that such data may be used for internal purposes in the context of the upcoming application process. If there is no employment, the data will be deleted after six months. The application data are treated confidentially in accordance with the provisions of the Federal Data Protection Act and are not passed on to third parties. You can revoke your consent at any time, either by email or in writing by mail.

Title: Fullstack AI Engineer ‚Äì WasteHero
Description:
Help us reinvent municipal infrastructure ‚Äì with AI.

At WasteHero, we're on a mission to build the most advanced, intelligent municipal software platform in Europe. Our customers are cities and waste companies ‚Äì the backbone of public life ‚Äì and we help them digitize operations, optimize resources, and become smarter every day. Now, we're ready to go AI-first. And we need a builder.

We're looking for a Fullstack AI Engineer who can combine classic engineering skills with modern AI tooling to ship real, production-grade AI agents, flows, and tools ‚Äì fast. This isn't a research role. This is about building things that work.

What You‚Äôll Do


Build internal AI agents that automate everything from public tender qualification to API-based integration flows.
Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to develop real, end-to-end flows.
Translate domain knowledge (from product, integration, support) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
Develop backend logic and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Supabase.
Collaborate directly with our founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and products.
Optionally: build or connect frontend UIs via Lovable, Retool, or React.


Who You Are


You have 2‚Äì4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
You've already built real things with AI ‚Äì agents, automations, internal tools, or API wrappers. (We‚Äôre not looking for beginners.)
You're comfortable with JavaScript/TypeScript or Python, REST APIs, and database logic.
You‚Äôve used tools like LangChain, GPT, Claude, Supabase, or n8n ‚Äî and ideally connected them together.
You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: experience with public infrastructure, tenders, waste, logistics, or ERP systems.


Why Join Us


Work on real-world AI problems ‚Äî not gimmicks.
Be part of a small, ambitious, and product-driven team with deep market traction.
Ship and own projects that get used by municipalities and companies across Europe.
Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: waste & city infrastructure.
Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.
Located in Aarhus? Great. Prefer hybrid or remote (within CET ¬±2)? Also great.


Tech Stack You‚Äôll Touch


GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
LangChain / n8n / Supabase
Python / Node.js / TypeScript
REST APIs (internal and customer)
Lovable / Retool / React (optional)
Other tech stacks that can improve efficiency


Compensation


Competitive salary based on experience
Equity/warrants
Office in Aarhus C with hybrid flexibility
Real ownership. No bureaucracy.


Ready to build the future of public infrastructure with AI?

Apply here

Let‚Äôs make cities smarter ‚Äî together.

Title: Vice President- Head of LEGO Fortnite ecosystem
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role must be based in Denmark full time

Are you passionate about contributing to the future of family friendly digital play?

Your ability to think on your feet whilst paving the way for a long term ambition will be critical to lead this strategic project for the LEGO Group. Acting like a GM and owning the P&L, you will own our strategic partnership with EPIC Games, ensuring constant mutual value creation and reaching both short and long term goals.

The LEGO Fortnite partnership is multifaceted, from stand alone licensed games, to self developed and published games, to user generated games, and you will lead and establish a meaningful presence inside the ever growing and changing Fortnite environment.


Core Responsibilities





Strategic Partnership management with EPIC Games
P&L ownership
Portfolio development across 1st, 2nd and 3rd party games
Publishing, marketing and UA experience
Driving short and long-term integration with the LEGO owned ecosystem
Continuous development of in-house capabilities




Play your part in our team succeeding

The LEGO Group has decided to dramatically expand its footprint in the gaming world. The EPIC Games partnership sits at the core of this strategy, establishing a long-term presence in open platforms.

You will drive the choices to accelerate the growth of our Fortnite audience, making the most out of what Fortnite has to offer, developing valuable business cases for EPIC Games to invest in and building in-house capabilities to create meaningful LEGO gaming experiences within Fortnite.

Making difficult decisions and negotiating with our partners, you be strong in navigating uncertainty, whilst remaining driven by a unique goal- delighting as many players as possible with LEGO Experiences!

Do you have what it takes?





Deep experience in digital platform management and/or gaming industry
Successful experiences in maintaining and developing strategic partnerships
P&L and digital product development experience
Understanding of legal and financial considerations, incl internal collaborator management
Deep gaming industry knowledge
Understanding / interest for kid-focused experiences
Program management
Marketing and branding strategy
Creator community management




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.


Show more

Title: Lead AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

team.blue is the market leader in enabling digital success for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across Europe, catering to over 3 million customers in 25+ languages. Our mission is to make online business success simpler, by providing our customers with all the tools and resources they need to excel online and remain ahead of the curve.

Position Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Lead AI/ML Engineer to technically lead our AI/ML engineering team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing AI & ML models and GenAI solutions that power real production use cases. This role will collaborate closely with Product, and Commercial teams, and take full ownership from ideation to deployment. The environment is fast-paced and high-responsibility, with plenty of room to grow alongside a technical, mission-driven team.

Key Responsibilities:

AI & ML Model Development & Implementation


Design, develop and optimize AI models and LLMs, including training and fine-tuning for various applications
Build, train and optimize ML models, including defining preprocessing, feature engineering, validation strategies, and hyperparameter tuning
Develop AI solutions using LLMs, agentic AI frameworks, RAG pipelines, MCP servers and other related technologies



AI & ML Engineering


Build data ingestion and transformation pipelines to support model training and deployment and ensure reproducible, scalable models
Verify data quality, perform data cleaning, and oversee data acquisition processes as needed.
Develop scalable training and inference pipelines for AI-powered applications



Deployment & Integration


Deploy models to production and create APIs to integrate AI models into business operations
Build and drive adoption of emerging LLM/MLOPs technologies, integrating AI Agents, RAGs, and LLMs using MCP workflows to streamline automation, performance tuning, and large-scale data insights



Research & Innovation


Continously research and integrate the latest advancements in AI, ML and LLMs into products
Translate scientific insights into working prototypes that bridge research and production-ready implementation
Collaborate with internal and external research partners, including academic institutions, industry labs, and vendors



Technical Leadership


Provide technical leadership in AI/ML technologies, including GenAI, Machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
Ensure the technical quality of AI/ML solutions, including architecture, design, implementation, and deployment.
Mentor junior team members and drive the technical direction of AI initiatives within the group



Requirements:


6+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering, Applied AI or Research engineering, with 2+ years in a lead role
Deep expertise with GenAI technologies and concepts like LLMs, RAG, Vector databases, AI agents, MCP, LoRA, QLoRA
Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, sklearn), with a proven track record of building and deploying ML models
Practical experience deploying and scaling AI & ML models and agentic AI applications in a production environment, including with LLM inference and serving (vLLm, LiteLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
Knowledge of LLM/MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Awareness of LLM-specific risk domains, including hallucinations, fairness, and data privacy
Strong problem-solving skills with excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams



Nice to have Skills:


Experience building multi-hop RAG systems with self-consistency and chain-of-thought prompting



"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

ESG

‚ÄúAt team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.‚Äù

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 3,000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You‚Äôll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
We're looking for an AI Software Engineer to help shape the direction of our new AI initiative and build intelligent systems powered by LLMs and AI agents right at the heart of our tech platform.




About CEGO

CEGO is an ambitious software company located by the waterfront in Aalborg. We offer an informal work culture with flexibility, freedom, and a high degree of trust. We operate Spilnu.dk, one of Denmark's largest online casinos, and have expanded our success to the UK with Happy Tiger. We develop everything in-house using open-source technologies from games and platforms to our upcoming AI projects.




About the role

We‚Äôre hiring for a newly established position as AI Software Engineer to join us on-site at our office in Aalborg, where you‚Äôll be responsible for developing next-generation AI solutions based on Large Language Models (LLMs), AI agents, and modern AI architectures.




This is a pioneering role where you'll be our first in-house specialist in this field. You'll bring a new technological toolbox to CEGO and play a key role in defining how we work with AI going forward. You'll collaborate closely with our talented developers in the Platform department, who will provide strong technical sparring - but you should thrive in leading the way into new territory.

You‚Äôll be part of our Platform department consisting of 38 colleagues, including DevOps, software developers, UX designers, and frontend developers.




Your main tasks include:

Develop and implement AI solutions using LLMs, AI agents, and machine learning techniques such as fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG (Retriever-Augmented Generation), ReACT, and meta-prompting
Design and optimize agent-based systems using technologies like LangChain, LangGraph, LangSmith, or similar
Build APIs and integrations to connect AI solutions with our existing systems
Contribute to innovation and prototyping across teams and business areas
Stay up to date on AI trends and evaluate how they can be applied to create business value




About you

We imagine you're a proactive team player with a developer mindset and a commercial edge. We‚Äôre looking for someone who:




Has a solid understanding of machine learning and can distinguish between classical ML and modern LLM applications
Is familiar with techniques like prompt chaining and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Understands agent-based AI systems and workflow orchestration
Has experience with API development and system integration
Is comfortable evaluating and optimizing AI model performance
Is curious and eager to explore new technologies




We offer:

A chance to join one of Aalborg‚Äôs most ambitious and attractive workplaces
Full ownership of our own products and roadmaps - no clients or external deadlines
No time tracking
An agile, flat organization with fast decision-making
Flexible working hours, 30 minutes of paid daily break, and a no-overtime policy
Perks like daily breakfast, in-house gym, personal training twice a week, and massage
A strong focus on well-being, professionalism, and collaboration
Health insurance and pension plan




We know that engaged and skilled employees create the best results. That‚Äôs why we work actively to ensure an environment where you can thrive and be challenged at the same time.




How to apply

Submit your CV and a motivated application via our website as soon as possible. We review applications on an ongoing basis. Start date is as soon as possible.




We encourage all qualified candidates to apply - regardless of gender, age, religion, or ethnic background.




About CEGO A/S

Founded in 2000, CEGO A/S operates a number of subsidiaries running online casinos in both Denmark and internationally. In 2012, we launched Spilnu.dk and were among the first companies to receive a casino license when Denmark liberalized its gambling laws.




Spilnu.dk features unique, in-house developed slot machines inspired by the classic "one-armed bandit" with a twist of engaging bonus games for extra fun. The platform encourages a social, cozy gaming experience, allowing players to chat while playing.




Outside Denmark, we operate in the UK under the brand Happy Tiger. CEGO A/S is owned by three Aalborg-based entrepreneurs and the private equity firm VIA equity.




You‚Äôll find us in our inspiring office at the waterfront in Aalborg, where about 130 employees work across game development, web development, game and sound design, graphics, customer support, server administration, and platform operations. We also have departments supporting Compliance & Legal, Marketing, Finance, and HR.

Show more

We also have departments supporting Compliance & Legal, Marketing, Finance, and HR.

Title: Freelance Mathematics Expert - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Content Creation & Refinement: Create and refine content to ensure accuracy and relevance across a variety of topics in Mathematics, while also developing references and examples of tasks.
Experts Acquisition: Assess the qualification tests of experts, ensuring their competency.
Chat Moderation: Provide support by addressing project-related questions from other experts in Discord chats, especially those related to project guidelines.
Auditing Work: Review and evaluate tasks completed by other experts, ensuring they align with project guidelines. Provide constructive feedback, verify expertise-related information, and edit content as necessary to improve quality


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Mathematics
You have at least 5 years of professional experience.
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
Experience in Generative AI/Prompt engineering/Reviewing
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: R&D Mechanical Engineer
Description:
Vil du v√¶re med til at udvikle fremtidens tekniske hj√¶lpemidler, som kan give mennesker en bedre livskvalitet? Og har du samtidig lyst til at arbejde i en ambiti√∏s international virksomhed med kollegaer i mange lande. S√• er du m√•ske den R&D Mechanical Engineer, vi s√∏ger til Patient Handling ved Horsens?
