Du vil skulle arbejde med produktudvikling omfattende flere forskellige teknologier, materialetyper og produktomr√•der. Produkterne er omfattet af det medicinske regulativ (MDR) og en ‚Äì p√• sigt - god forst√•else af dette, markedet og kunderne er v√¶sentlige foruds√¶tninger for succes i rollen.

Opgaverne vil prim√¶rt omfatte l√¶ngerevarende udviklingsforl√∏b kombineret med mindre kortsigtede projekter/opgaver, der til tider besluttes iv√¶rksat med baggrund i et specifikt kunde behov.

Du bliver en del af vores Patient Handling team i Gedved, der besk√¶ftiger sig med kundesupport og udvikling af Molift og Immedia produkterne.

Dine konkrete arbejdsopgaver vil is√¶r omfatte:


Udvikling af nye produkter og div. tilbeh√∏r med tilh√∏rende dokumentation og manualer.
Arbejde med konstruktioner i aluminium og st√•l samt st√∏bte emner i b√•de plast og metal, herunder f√∏re dialogen direkte med underleverand√∏rer om fremstillings teknik.
Gennemf√∏re tests af de udviklede produkter i laboratorium og/eller i marken.
Sparring med kollegaer i andre funktionsomr√•der herunder produktion samt elektronik og software teamet.
Arbejde med/efter/mod standarder godkendelser og frembringe dokumentation hertil.
Medvirke til afdelingens faglige udvikling og sociale sammenhold
Deltage aktivt i risikovurderinger (DFMEA/PFMEA)
Diverse ad-hoc-opgaver.


Stillingen refererer direkte til R&D-chefen.

Du skal regne med en vis planlagt rejseaktivitet prim√¶rt i Europa p√• 20 til 30 dage √•rligt ‚Äì oftest 1-3 dages ture.

Kvalifikationer

Du har sikkert en grundl√¶ggende uddannelse som M-ingeni√∏r, gerne med sundhedsfaglig erfaring/baggrund, men det er ikke et krav.

Det er en kr√¶vende stilling og vi s√∏ger derfor en person med flere √•rs praktisk erfaring fra udvikling af mekaniske produkter i en produktions- eller konsulentvirksomhed.

Det er en fordel hvis ud har erfaring med det medicinske regulativ (MDR).

Du behersker MS-Officepakken p√• avanceret brugerniveau med fokus p√• Excel.

Du har kendskab til g√¶ngse ERP-systemer og du er helt fortrolig med avanceret brug af 3D-CAD og PDM ‚Äì Etac anvender SolidWorks.

Du behersker dansk p√• modersm√•lsniveau og engelsk p√• forhandlingsniveau i skrift og tale.

P√• det personlige plan b√∏r du kunne genkende dig selv i nedenst√•ende:


Rummer b√•de kreative og analytiske elementer, der g√∏r at du skaber innovative og brugbare l√∏sninger.
Struktureret og detaljeorienteret uden at det g√•r ud over overblikskapacitet og prioriteringerne.
Leverer l√∏sninger til tiden i et velfungerende samarbejde med andre funktioner.
Udviklingsorienteret, pragmatisk og proaktiv.
Du er rejsevant i Europa og har en god interkulturel kompetence.
Positivt sind og godt hum√∏r g√∏r bestemt ikke noget, og du er klar til at give en h√•nd og sparre med og st√∏tte kollegaerne i deres opgaver.


Virksomheden tilbyder

Du f√•r et afvekslende og inspirerende job i en moderne, international og hastigt voksende virksomhed med betydelige jobm√¶ssige udfordringer og tv√¶rorganisatorisk arbejde ‚Äì ofte p√• tv√¶rs af landegr√¶nser.

Du vil opleve at man har de bedst t√¶nkelige arbejdsredskaber og du m√∏der en flok dedikerede og dygtige kolleger i et uformelt og dynamisk milj√∏.

Du f√•r s√•ledes en god mulighed for en solid personlig og faglig udvikling i et sp√¶ndende internationalt markedssegment.

Der er h√∏jt til loftet og betydelige frihedsgrader i jobbet baseret p√• gensidig tillid.

Om os

Patient Handling med Molift og Immedia er to blandt flere produktbrands i Etac Group.

Etac Group er en verdensf√∏rende udvikler af innovative hj√¶lpemidler og patienth√•ndteringsudstyr. Siden 1973 har vi v√¶ret forpligtet til at forbedre livskvaliteten for den enkelte, familiemedlemmer og p√•r√∏rende. Gennem vores specialiserede produktm√¶rker tilbyder vi state-of-the-art l√∏sninger til en bred vifte af daglige behov og plejemilj√∏er for mennesker p√• alle stadier af livet.

Etac har hoveds√¶de i Sverige og mere end 1500 ansatte p√• verdensplan og salg i over 70 lande gennem salgsselskaber og distribut√∏rer. Etac Group er repr√¶senteret globalt med datterselskaber i b√•de Danmark, Sverige, Norge, England, Frankrig, USA, Tyskland, Italien, Holland og Australien. Herudover leverer eksportafdelingen til store dele af verden. I Gedved er vi ca. 200 medarbejdere, heraf ca. 25 medarbejdere i Patient Handling.

Du kan l√¶se mere om Etac Group: https://www.etac.com/ hvor du ogs√• finder mere viden om Molift og Immedia.

Interesseret?

Stillingen √∏nskes besat snarest muligt og vi holder l√∏bende samtaler. Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l, kan du kontakte Peter Jensen, Head of R&D PBU Patient Handling, p√• tlf.: 20 13 28 51

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Rust) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: R&D Application Engineer
Place: Ringk√∏bing-Skjern Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Join Our Global R&D Team as an Application Engineer

Are you passionate about bridging cutting-edge R&D with real-world production? Do you enjoy hands-on experimentation, rapid prototyping, and turning ideas into tangible improvements? Then this could be your next exciting opportunity!




At the Va group (Vestas aircoil), we‚Äôre engineering the future of heat transfer solutions. As part of our global R&D team, you‚Äôll help turn lab concepts into automated processes - bringing innovation directly to our production sites across the world.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As R&D Application Engineer, you‚Äôll help scale new technology from lab to production (TRL4 to TRL7), working closely with production teams and our Romanian site. You will:

Accelerate technology implementation in production
Mature New Technologies through rapid experimentation, prototyping and technical development
Lead development projects and drive automation projects
Collaborate cross-functionally to scope and deliver value-focused solutions
Translate technical concepts for non-specialist audiences
Support patent applications and promote our R&D lab internally and externally
Run small-scale experiments and rapid prototyping (machining/additive manufacturing)
Ensure lab compliance and contribute to maintaining a safe, innovative workspace




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Technical degree (Mechanical/Marine Engineer, Toolmaker, or similar)
Understand mechanical and mechatronic systems and how tools and machinery operate
Understanding the properties of different materials and their suitability for specific tools or applications in productions
Structured, curious mindset with strong communication skills
Willingness to travel as part of the role is required
Fluent in English (written/spoken)
Comfortable with MS Office, Teams, and SharePoint




Why Join Us?

We are a growing global company with Danish roots and a reputation for excellence in industrial cooling solutions. While our size allows for agility and personal impact, our global presence offers collaboration across borders and disciplines.




We pride ourselves on our informal yet professional work culture, where innovation, integrity, and continuous improvement guide our daily actions. You‚Äôll join a supportive team that values your initiative, curiosity, and desire to make a difference.




Ready to Apply?

If this sounds like your next step, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. We review applications on a rolling basis. Questions? Reach out to HR Generalist, Maria Skallerup at +45 3118 9319 or ms@vestas-aircoil.com or Group R&D Director, Claus Hessler Ibsen at ci@vetas-aircoil.com.




Let‚Äôs shape the future of heat transfer innovation - together.

Title: Robotics Technician
Description:
ROBOT TECHNICIAN COPENHAGEN BASED WITH EXTENSIVE TRAVELLING WORLDWIDE




CLIIN Robotics is looking for a Robot Technician to train and demonstrate our solutions to customers in the maritime and oil & gas industries worldwide.




About CLIIN Robotics:

We are a young, ambitious, innovative company working for a cleaner and safer future in the maritime and oil & gas industries. We design, develop and build proprietary robotic solutions for vessel cargo hold and hull cleaning, replacing ineffective, dangerous, and polluting traditional cleaning operations. In addition, our robotic platform and sustainable value propositions are being deployed across other industries, e.g. tank storage, offshore installations, which provide a unique opportunity to further expand the business across various business segments worldwide.




About the job:

Our solutions constitute a paradigm shift to traditional maritime cleaning methods and are gaining significant market traction. Our Robot Technicians‚Äô engagement is key to ensuring that our customers are yielding maximum value from the deployment of our solutions.¬†




After a period of thorough introduction to our technology and solutions at our head office in Copenhagen, Denmark, you will travel to our customers in a range of different deployment settings worldwide in order to train and demonstrate operability and maintenance. Thus ability and flexibility to travel are a prerequisite.




It is essential that you are a solid communicator and can engage in profound customer dialogues and foster long-term relationships.




When not travelling, you will continue to render support to our customers on an as-needed basis, and form part of our production and development team in order to stay abreast with our technology and contribute to the continued development.




You will be part of a growing organization and a growing number of Robot Technicians at CLIIN Robotics.




Location: Copenhagen-based

To foster close collaboration with our team, this role requires you to be based in Denmark. We have a strong preference for candidates living within commuting distance of our Copenhagen office.




Profile:

The preferred candidate has a solid technical education and background, preferably from the shipping or offshore industries.




Responsibilities:

Demonstrate our solutions at our customer settings worldwide.
Train end users in solutions, operations and maintenance.
Render continued technical/operational support to customers through mail and phone.
Build and test solutions for customers.
Participate in internal tests and continued solutions development.
Observe and collect development opportunities based on experience from practical deployment.




The job is for you if:

You have a technical education (electrician, marine engineer, technical engineer or similar) and subsequent practical experience.
Experience from shipping and/or oil & gas.
Strong ability to work both independently and in teams.
Solid communicator and good at building relationships.
Thrive in a flat organization with a ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude.
As a minimum, are fluent in English (written and spoken). Proficiency in Spanish will be seen as a significant advantage.
You are willing to travel around 200+ days a year.




Come work with us!

You will be a part of a dynamic international and highly professional team of experts with significant experience.¬†By becoming a CLIIN Robotics employee, you will be part of a growing, innovative organization with room to develop.

Like the rest of us - you want to change the world to a better place for this generation and beyond.




Ready to Apply? Don't wait¬†

For further information, please contact Sales Director, Thomas Joergensen (+45 29249712) or email your application and CV to e-mail: tj@cliin.dk¬†




Applications are evaluated continuously, and interviews will take place as soon as possible. Until we have found the right person.¬†




Your application will be treated with confidentiality.




We look forward to hearing from you and reviewing your application and CV.¬†

Show more

Ready to Apply? Don't wait 

For further information, please contact Sales Director, Thomas Joergensen (+45 29249712) or email your application and CV to e-mail: tj@cliin.dk 


Applications are evaluated continuously, and interviews will take place as soon as possible. Until we have found the right person.

Title: Freelance Software Developer (JavaScript) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Code generation and code review
Prompt evaluation and complex data annotation
Training and evaluation of large language models
Benchmarking and agent-based code execution in sandboxed environments
Working across multiple programming languages (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Rust, SQL, etc.)
Adapting guidelines for new domains and use cases
Following project-specific rubrics and requirements
Collaborating with project leads, solution engineers, and supply managers on complex or experimental projects


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Ruby, hands-on experience with JS testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha, Cypress) and browser automation
Experience using, integrating, or tutoring others on AI tools in the QA or development process
Experience documenting and tracking defects clearly
Hackathon or competitive coding experience is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

HTML:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Code generation and code review
  • Prompt evaluation and complex data annotation
  • Training and evaluation of large language models
  • Benchmarking and agent-based code execution in sandboxed environments
  • Working across multiple programming languages (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Rust, SQL, etc.)
  • Adapting guidelines for new domains and use cases
  • Following project-specific rubrics and requirements
  • Collaborating with project leads, solution engineers, and supply managers on complex or experimental projects

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
  • You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Ruby, hands-on experience with JS testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha, Cypress) and browser automation
  • Experience using, integrating, or tutoring others on AI tools in the QA or development process
  • Experience documenting and tracking defects clearly
  • Hackathon or competitive coding experience is a plus
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Vi s√∏ger en medarbejder, der b√•de kan indg√• i sammensatte hold og arbejde selvst√¶ndigt i Danmark og i udlandet, hvor der er dansk milit√¶r repr√¶sentation.

Du f√•r en hverdag, som du i h√∏j grad selv skal tilrettel√¶gge, med stort ansvar og samtidig stor personlig frihed. Du f√•r en hverdag, hvor du har en meget bred kontakt med alle dele af Forsvaret. Som i Forsvaret har du pligt til kortvarig udsendelse til udlandet.

Vi forventer, at de indledende ans√¶ttelsessamtaler vil finde sted i uge 34 og 35 og stiler mod en ans√¶ttelse fra 1. oktober 2025 eller snarest derefter.

Du er velkommen til at kontakte den lokale HR-partner p√• mailadresserne FE-1119@mil.dk (i ugerne 28/29 & 33) eller 22376@ddis.dk (i uge 32), hvis du har sp√∏rgsm√•l til stillingen eller √∏nsker flere oplysninger.
